loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet, de 27 años es una mujer trabajadora. Ella vive en compañía de William, su esposo desde hace 10 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Estefanía, Josue y Jean Carlos; a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Usibamba. El trabajo continuo es su lema. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano prepara los alimentos que venderá en la escuela de su localidad. Donde hace 2 años abrió un pequeño negocio, en el cual vende golosinas, bebidas y comida casera a los alumnos y profesores que cada refrigerio visitan a Yanet. Cuenta que fue difícil para ella obtener el permiso para vender dentro de la institución, “pero nada es difícil si eres constante”, afirma. Al mismo tiempo y como mujer del campo; se dedica a la siembra de avena y crianza de vacas. Siembra en terrenos de su comunidad todos los fines de semana y realiza yogurt y queso con la leche de sus vacas. Pero la actividad que le trae más ganancias es la venta de helados y chupetes los días de feria de su zona, donde ella obtiene buenas ganancias. Ahora desea trabajar con más ahínco en todas las actividades que desarrolla, pues es ahí donde se siente realizada. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Yanet, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más helados para vender en la feria, y su el dinero le alcanza comprará golosinas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Yanet, 27, is a hardworking woman. She lives with William, her husband of 10 years.  They have three children, Estefanía, Josué and Jean Carlos, who she cares for in her own house located in Usibamba.  Her motto is constant work.  She prepares the food she’ll sell at her local school very early in the morning.  She opened a small business there two years ago selling snacks, soft-drinks and home-made food to students and teachers who visit Yanet during recess.  She says that it was difficult for her to get permission to sell inside the school but “nothing’s difficult is you stick with it,” she affirms.

At the same time, being a woman from the countryside, she also grows oats and raises cows.  She plants on communal land every weekend and makes yoghurt and cheese with milk from her cows.  But the activity that is most profitable is selling ice-cream and frozen pops during her local market days; she earns good profits then.

She now wants to work with more dedication in all of her activities because that’s how she feels fulfilled.  She belongs to the “Usibamba” communal bank and this is her 6th MFP loan.  She is grateful for the financial support she’s constantly being granted because now she has the means to improve her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments since she’s been taught to be responsible.  Yanet will use the requested money to buy more frozen treats to sell during market day and if the money goes far enough she will also buy snacks for her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks and ice-cream.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry birds and dairy goats.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma, de 32 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de su esposo Edson con quien tiene 3 hijos: Kevin, Cristian y Joseph, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada desde hace 3 años. La mayor pasión de su esposo es el baile, sobre todo las danzas típicas de todas las regiones del país. Fue entonces que junto a él decidieron convertir esta pasión en un medio para salir adelante, desde entonces pasaron 14 años dedicando su tiempo y esfuerzo en enseñar a diversas instituciones, estudiantes y demás personas danzas costumbristas; con el tiempo adicionó a sus enseñanzas los trajes típicos de cada una de ellas. Norma se dedica a confeccionar cuidar y limpiar los disfraces que día a día su esposo alquila como un adicional a su enseñanza, obtiene buenos ingresos semanales, sobre todo en las fechas festivas o cualquier evento de este tipo en la ciudad. Ahora se encuentran diseñando los disfraces para el baile “solteritos de jauja”, además de disfraces con materiales reciclables, pues es más económico y ayudan con mantener el planeta. “En estos tiempos todas los colegios lo piden”, afirma. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Norma, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 36 disfraces del baile típico de “solteritos”, ya tiene el pedido de estos disfraces y quiere cumplir a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma, 32, is a simple woman. She lives in the company of her husband Edson with whom she has three children: Kevin, Cristian and Joseph, whom she cares for in a rental home where they have lived for three years. Her husband's greatest passion is dance, above all the traditional dances from all the country's regions. Thus they together decided to turn this passion into a means of getting ahead. Since then they have have spent 14 years dedicating their time and effort to teaching various institutions, students and other persons the local dance customs. In time they added to their teachings the traditional costumes to go along with each one. Norma spends her time sewing, caring for and cleaning the costumes that her husband rents day by day as a side business to their teaching. They make good weekly earnings and especially on holidays or any event of this kind in the city. Now they are busy designing costumes for the "single men of Jauja" dance as well as costumes made from recyclable materials since it is more economical and helps maintain the planet. "These days all the schools are asking for it," she states. 

This is her eighth loan with MFP and she appreciates the financial support they have continually granted her. Now she has the means to improve her business. She promises to be punctual with her payments since she was taught to be responsible. Norma will invest the money in the purchase of 36 costumes for the traditional "single men" dance. She has already received the order for these costumes and wants to satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to purchase 36 traditional dance costumes for single male dancers, which have already been ordered, in order to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: William  Leonardo

texts.es: William tiene 30 de edad vive en el suburbio de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Está casado tiene 2 hijos el mayor de 10 años y el menor de 8 años los 2 asisten a una escuela pública  de sector. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogos. William comenzó ya hace 12 años atrás con la elaboración de perfumes caseros ya que fue su tío que le enseño este trabajo. Con el préstamo quiere comprar esencias aromáticas, químicos para la elaboración de los perfumes, botella, etc. Su gran sueño es ser un distribuidor de perfumes en todo el país y abrir su propio local de ventas de perfumes.
texts.en: William is 30 years old and lives in the area surrounding the city of Guayaquil. He is married and has two children. The oldest is 10 and the youngest is 8; the two of them attend a public school in the area. His wife earns a living selling cosmetics by catalog. Twelve years ago William began making homemade perfumes since his uncle taught him this work. With the loan he wishes to buy essential oils and chemicals for making perfumes, bottles, etc. His great dream is to be a distributor of perfumes throughout the country and open his own local shop for selling perfumes.

loans.use: to purchase essential oils and chemicals.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es:
Mujeres entregadas y perseverantes, por eso decidieron llamarle Sol al grupo, pues creen que el día es para trabajarse.
Una de sus integrantes es Petra, madre de familia, dedicada al hogar, que mediante favores con vecinas, descubrió una oportunidad de negocio: la costura.
Con una maquina con la que cose en casa, empezó a emendar ropa de vecinos, se fue pasando la voz, para cuando se dio cuenta ya estaba frente a un negocio propio.
Hoy ella quiere tomar este crédito para darle mantenimiento a su maquina y con ello, poder seguir ofreciendo este servicio y crecer su clientela.
texts.en:
Dedicated and persistent, these women decided to call the group "Sol" [Sun], as they believe that the day is made for work. 

Petra, one of its members, is a housewife devoted to her home. By doing favors for her neighbors, she discovered a business opportunity, sewing. With a sewing machine that she sews with at home, she started to mend her neighbors' clothes. Word spread and she realized she actually had a real business. 

She would like to use this loan today in order to maintain her machine and thus be able to continue to offer this service as well as grow her clientele.

loans.use: to invest in the maintenance of her sewing machine

loans.name: Jargalsaihan

texts.en: Mr. Jargalsaihan is 46 years old, married, and has two children. They live in the village of Selenge a province of Mongolia.  His wife, Siilegmaa, works as a teacher at a secondary school. Mr. Jargalsaihan is a vegetable vendor in his village. He started a planting and selling organic vegetables business in 2008. He used to operate a clothes retail business for 8 years before that. He is a business-minded person. He buys vegetables seeds, plants organic vegetables, and sells them at retail prices the whole year long. He is planning to expand his business in order to increase his income and profit. Therefore, he requests a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to build a vegetable storing pit to reserve enough amounts of vegetables to sell throughout the 4 seasons. He is a diligent and hard working man whose purpose is to make a better future for his kids and send them to good universities to educate them better. He believes that his business will continue to grow and cover all further family expenses.

loans.use: To build a vegetable storing pit to reserve enough amounts of vegetables

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Ms Sajida is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of stitching for many years. She is very familiar with the stitching techniques and has become famous in her community. Her husband is employed in a small factory. His income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. This compelled her to start her business to contribute to the family income.  Sajida is a mother of five: three daughters and two sons. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. However, these days she is facing problems in completing orders on time due to a shortage of raw material. For this reason she requested a loan of 25,000 PKRs to buy more reels of threads in different colors and packs of laces, buttons and zips for embellishments. She is hopeful to earn more by serving more customers consistently. She desires to utilize part of the profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: To buy more reels of threads in different colors and packs of laces, buttons and zips for embellishments.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Ms. Safia is a 45-year-old, vigorous married woman. She has been doing a business of hand embroidery for the past two years. 

She beautifully makes patterns and becomes famous in her community.  She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong, but the business challenges, combined with the family expenditures she faces, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her husband is employed as a sales person in a grocery store. He earns not enough to support his family well, while Safia is the best earning resource of her house, as her embroidery patterns are very popular in her street.

Safia is a mother of three children; all are school-going. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy raw material such as reels of thread, packs of sequins, and pearls in large quantity to meet with the increasing demand.  

She shared her dreams of running a training center for girls of her village to train them and to transfer her skills, so that they can help her in expanding her business and also earn for them.

loans.use: to buy raw material such as reels of thread, packs of sequins, and pearls in large quantity to meet with the increasing demand.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 38-year-old man. He is married to Felista and together they have four children. He operates a butcher shop and has been in the business for the past six years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loan successfully and in good time. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of meat for resale in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to make more profits so as to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of meat to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 54-year-old single mother. She is still practicing mixed crop farming. She has been in the farming business for the past eleven years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan term from  KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. With the previous loan she bought fertilizer, seedlings and one goat. Her farming business did well and she made a profit from the loan. 

Jane will use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to improve her farming business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will buy another goat and improve her living standard. Her current hopes and dreams are to improve especially on horticultural farming and to begin exporting her farm's produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Joselyn Arleth

texts.es: Joselyn tiene 18 años de edad es de la ciudad La Libertad de la provincia de Santa Elena. Ella es soltera no tiene hijos .Joselyn  comenzó con la ilusión  de vender cosmético y vio que si era productivo esa actividad pues en la actualidad ese es su fuente de trabajo. De esa manera ella ayuda a su madre con los gastos de la casa. Joselyn quería hacer un préstamo desde antes pero como era menor de edad no podía pero ahora con la ayuda de Dios podrá tener capital para poder ampliar su negocio y que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos con la diversidad de productos que ofrecerá. Con el préstamo ella quiere comprar perfumes, cremas corporales, lociones, maquillajes, etc.
texts.en: Joselyn, 18, is from the city of La Libertad in the province of Santa Elena. She is single and has no children. Joselyn began with the dream of selling cosmetics and saw that the business was profitable since currently that is her source of work. In this way she helps her mother with household expenses. Joselyn wanted to get a loan sooner but since she was a minor she couldn't. Now with God's help she will be able to have the capital to expand her business so her customers will be satisfied with the diversity of products she offers for sale. With the loan she wants to buy perfumes, body creams, lotions, makeup, etc.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, body creams, lotions, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Norma Esperanza

texts.es: Norma vive en Manta ciudad de la Provincia de Manabí. Está casada tiene 1 hijo mayor de edad pero todavía estudia en un colegio público cerca de su domicilio, su esposo es un conductor de una cooperativa de taxi. Norma con ganas de superarse y aportar en su hogar tomo la decisión de vender empanadas de plátano. Norma se levanta a las 6 de la mañana a comprar el plátano y en las tardes ella vende las empanadas recorriendo su barrio. Con el préstamo quiere comprar plátano, queso, herramientas para la elaboración de las empanadas. Su meta es logar tener un local propio y poder vender todo tipo de bocaditos y también distribuirlos en los colegios y escuelas.
texts.en:
Norma lives in the city of Manta in the province of Manabí. She is married and has a child who has reached the age of majority but still studies at a public high school near her home. Her husband is a driver for a taxi cooperative. Norma, with the desire to improve herself and make a contribution to her household, made the decision to sell banana empanadas. Norma gets up at 6 in the morning to purchase bananas and in the afternoons she sells them throughout the neighborhood. 

With the loan she wants to buy bananas, cheese and tools for making the empanadas. Her goal is to have her own shop where she can sell all kinds of snack foods as well as distribute them to the high schools and elementary schools.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, cheese and tools for making empanadas.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 and is from Kisii county, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and six children who are all in school. She has been in farming for fifteen years, producing maize, peas, and potatoes which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a 41,600 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow which will help her earn more income that will help her in educating her children. The cow will also improve the health of her family from the milk products she will produce. In the next five years, Rose plans to buy a motorbike which will help her in transporting her milk to her clients and also to buy two more cows.

Poor road networks, diseases and lack of skills are her main challenges.

She is very happy to be financed by Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Tonin

texts.en:
Tonin is 32 and a married father of two little kids, 3 and 1 year old. He and his family live in northwest Albania. He comes from a family that falls under the poverty line and he claims that for long time while he was growing up, he did not understand why he had to live so poorly. “My eyes were always full of tears and everyone could sense the sadness I was in all the time. Until one day, World Vision Albania started its activity in my region and my family was helped. Even though I was not a child any more, I still benefited from the program, and I can’t thank them enough”, he claimes.
 
Tonin’s source of income has been through livestock (cows and goats) activities for the past couple years and he sells milk and baby animals to locals. He started to build a separate stable for the goats in the summer, yet the money was not enough. This is the reason why he is in need of this loan and prays that lenders will help him financially.
 
Tonin’s only objective in life is to give his children a much better life from what he has had and he works very hard to achieve that.

loans.use: To finish building his goats' stable before the end of this month

loans.name: 060318-Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Trúc works in agriculture farming, poultry, and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise. 

Trúc is 51 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 060318-Đại giang - Hoằng Châu solidarity group.  Trúc supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her children are grown up. Trúc has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

In 2003, Trúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Trúc has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

The main harsdhip that Trúc faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Trúc hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is from Keda district of West Georgia. She is 39 years old, and lives with her husband, two children and retired mother-in-law. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. More specifically, the family owns a plot of land where different kinds of vegetables, fruit and tobacco leaves are grown. Tamar and her family do all of the relevant agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are then sold at the local open market. Tamar is a very hard-working woman with a lot of experience in this work.

Tamar has requested a loan to purchase beehives with bee colonies. This will enable her to produce ecologically clean honey that she can then sell at the local open market. This investment will increase her family's income. 

Another part of the loan will be used for home renovations. Tamar's existing house is old and damaged, so she is seeking a loan to purchase building materials to repair it. Once repaired, the living conditions of the family will be improved, and they will be able to spend their evenings in a more comfortable environment.

loans.use: to purchase beehives with bee colonies, and to renovate her house

loans.name: Bornes

texts.en:
Bornes is 37 years old and is married to Martin. They have two children, ages 17 and 10. She raises fish in her farm, and has been in operation for a period of three years. Her average monthly income is 10,000 KES.  

Bornes is requesting to borrow 50,000 KES from KADET LTD. This will be her first business loan from KADET LTD, and with it she intends to purchase fingerlings for her pond.

Her profits will be used to purchase more fingerlings and educate her children. She hopes to prosper in her business.

loans.use: to purchase fingerlings for her fish pond

loans.name: Alexandra Maclovia

texts.es: Alexandra tiene 54 años de edad. Ella vive en el cantón La Libertad de la provincia de Santa Elena. Esta soltera  porque su ex pareja la abandonó  tiene  1 hija. Ella siempre le ha gustado tener su negocio propio ya que comenzó con una lubricadora como su primer negocio pero a causa de una enfermedad de su madre, ella tomo la decisión de venderlo. En la actualidad Alexandra abrió otro negocio que es de bazar y papelería la cual vende laminas, cuadernos. Ella trabaja con la ayuda de su hija, juntas trabajan de lunes a domingo de 7 de la mañana hasta la 7  de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere comprar artículos de bazar como cuadernos, carpetas, etc. Su deseo es surtir su negocio para asi poder llenar las necesidad de sus clientes.
texts.en: Alexandra is 54 years old. She lives in the canton La Libertad of the province of Santa Elena. She is single because her ex-partner left her. She has one daughter. She has always liked having a business of her own and began with an automotive lube shop as her first business, but after her mother fell ill she made the decision to sell it. Currently Alexandra has opened another business which is a "dollar" store and stationery shop where she sells notebooks and other educational supplies. She works with the help of her daughter; together they work Monday to Sunday from 7 a.m. until 7 p.m. With the loan she wishes to buy assorted items such as notebooks, folders, etc. Her wish is to stock her business in order to meet her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, folders and pens.

loans.name: Hipolito Wilberto

texts.es: Hipólito vive en la ciudad de Manta.  Está casado y sus hijos son mayores de edad por lo que son independientes. Cuando  Hipólito se retiro de su trabajo como policía invirtió su dinero en comprarse un carro, por lo que ahora es conductor de un taxi. Su esposa es costurera y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. El se levanta a trabajar a las  5 de la mañana y termina su jornada de trabajo a las 9 de la noche. Su meta es comprarse 2 carros mas y asi poderle dar trabajo a personas que no lo tengan. Con el préstamo Hipólito comprara llantas, bocina para el auto etc.
texts.en:
Hipólito lives in the city of Manta. He is married and his children are adults and thus are independent. When Hipólito retired from his job as a police officer he invested his money in the purchase of a car and so now he is a taxi driver. His wife is a dressmaker and helps him with household expenses. He gets up for work at 5 a.m. and finishes his work day at 9 p.m. His goal is to buy two more cars and so provide work for those who do not have it. With the loan 
Hipólito will purchase tires, a horn for the vehicle, etc.

loans.use: to purchase tires, a horn for the vehicle, etc.

loans.name: Enhbaatar

texts.en: Mr. Enhbaatar is 31 years old, lives with his family in a ger (a felt lined tent) in the Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife is named Tuvshruh and helps her husband and his business. His three children go to the secondary school and the youngest one is 1 year old and stays at home with his wife. He started to make national shoes at his home in 1996. Now he is starting his brand new business as a transportation service provider. His estimated income and profit for the business is better than his cobbler business and now he is requesting 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a mini-truck to provide transportation for locals. He is a hardworking and friendly man who says that "I need to build a small house for my family, because the kids are growing so fast and we cannot fit in ger any longer."

loans.use: To purchase a mini-truck to provide a transportation business for locals

loans.name: Las De Claridad Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DE CLARIDAD”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de calzados, venta de CD’s, venta de pescados, venta de celulares, costura de polleras, compra de red.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de nuestra institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio costura de polleras a pedido; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió al trabajar en un taller de costura, posteriormente decidió emprender su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo distribuirá a las tiendas a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Women of Clarity” communal bank has launched its 1st loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Achacachi Focal Center. The bank is composed of 10 members and is led by a board of directors with Mrs. Carmen Rosa as President. The businesses the communal association's members pursue are varied. Among these are: selling shoes, CDs, fish, and cell phones; making traditional skirts, and buying fish nets.

The loan they are requesting will benefit micro-enterprises, including the business of member Mrs. Carmen Rosa. She says this is the 1st time she has worked through Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a promoter from that institution. Currently, Carmen's business makes traditional skirts to measure. She says she learned the business while working in a seamstress shop; then she decided to start her own shop.

The loan she is soliciting will increase her capital for purchasing cloth from wholesalers. After making the skirts, Carmen will distribute them to stores on request. This type of work allows her to generate resources to help, as much as possible, with household expenses, since she lives in a common law marriage and has a son.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Carmen Rosa responded that she especially likes the health program.

loans.use: to buy cloth for making traditional skirts.

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Ms Raheela is 21-year-old single lady. She is very talented and excels in her work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community, and has decided to initiate her own business with support of Kasf Foundation.  She is living with her parents and has four siblings; she is the eldest among them.  Her father is a government servant. His income is not enough to cover the family expenditures. Raheela is contributing enough to the family income by using her great skills of stitching. To cope with the increasing demand she requested a loan of 20,000 PKRs to buy more reels of threads and packs of buttons and zips in different colors.  She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to expand her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her siblings through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy more reels of threads and packs of buttons and zips in different colors for her stitching.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther has been selling a variety of used clothes in Olkalou Town for the last three years. She is 49 years old, and a single mother of five school children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and this will be her third loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to cater for her family's needs.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and move into a more permanent shop from which to sell, as she currently sells from the roadside.

loans.use: to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima, 27, is married and has three children, all in school.

She is a very hard-working woman who has always liked earning income on her own. She has had a business for a while and it has given her good results. Today, she is requesting a loan to open a vegetable stall to sell a variety of fruits and vegetables. 
This loan will help Mwanalima buy tomatoes, potatoes, kale, cabbage, bananas, etc. Mwanalima anticipates achieving the best results from this investment.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, kale, cabbage, bananas, etc.

loans.name: Nkuyata

texts.en:
Nkuyata is 29 years old, married and supports a family of four. He has been a maize farmer for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He is requesting a second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase farm inputs. The anticipated profits will be used to help him diversify into sheep raising. His dream is to improve his financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said has been butcher shop owner since 2004. He is married to a housewife and they have six children, all in school. To purchase more meat for his butcher shop, he is requesting a second loan from Yehu. With the profits, he wants to bolster his business and ensure that his family is self-sufficient in terms of food. 
He has many goals to achieve and is determined to meet all of them through his efforts and your support.

loans.use: To purchase more meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen used his previous loan amount to buy a bull for slaughter. It was profitable and he was able to pay off the loan amount in good time.

This will be his second loan and he plans to buy goats for slaughter to add to his stock of meat for sale in his butcher shop. He will use the generated profits to buy more goats.

He hopes to grow his business by opening more butcher shops, earn more income and be able to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, a mechanic in Nyahururu town, used his previous loan amount to buy motorcycle spare parts to sell and use in his motorcycle repair business and it has been profitable. Besides the motorcycle repair business, he is also a poultry farmer.

This being his third loan term, he plans to buy chickens to raise and later sell. He will also supply the eggs to various shop retailers. He will use the generated profits to buy more poultry and motorcycle spare parts as well.

He hopes to grow his spare parts and poultry businesses and make more income to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Virginiah

texts.en:
Virginiah is 35 years old and a mother of five children.  She is married to Peter.  She does tailoring in Nakuru Town, and has been in the business for six years.  It has been profitable.

This being her first loan from KADET LTD, she plans to buy sewing materials for use in her business. She wants to have enough stock of material for sewing and to be able to satisfy her customers' needs, since she usually gets many orders for clothes during the coming festive season in December.

She hopes to grow her business, and to be able to open more tailoring businesses in the area.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José vive en la ciudad de Manta provincia de Manabí. Es padre soltero tiene 1 hijo que asiste a un colegio publico de sector. Todo empezó cuando su ex pareja los abandono a Él y a su hijo y fue entonces que tuvo que salir adelante siendo madre y padre para su hijo. Hace 7 años empezó con el negocio de venta de productos de cosméticos por catálogos. La forma de trabajo es recorrer diversos lugares de la ciudad ofertando los productos entre amigos y conocidos.  José por el momento no ha tenido ningún inconveniente en cuanto a la delincuencia y espera poder continuar de esta manera. Con el crédito piensa comprar artículos de belleza como labiales, sombras, perfumes, cremas etc. Su sueño más grande es arreglar su casa y que su negocio crezca para poderle dar una mejor vida a su hijo
texts.en:
José lives in the city of Manta province of Manabí. He is a single father and has one son who attends a public high school in the area. Everything began when his ex-partner left him and his child. That was when he had to forge ahead being both mother and father to his son. Seven years ago he began with the business of selling cosmetics by catalog. His way of working is to travel to various parts of the city offering the products to friends and acquaintances. For the time being José is not having any problems with crime and hopes to continue in the same way. 

With the loan he plans to purchase beauty supplies such as lipstick, eye shadow, perfumes, creams etc. His biggest dream is to get his house fixed up and that his business would grow in order to provide a better life for his son.

loans.use: to purchase lipstick, eye shadow, perfumes and creams.

loans.name: Linda Azucena

texts.es: Linda vive en el suburbio de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Ella es  casada tiene 2 hijos 1 de 4 años y el otro de 3 años. Linda Compro una vitrina y una percha fue ahi cuando empezó la apertura de su negocio vendiendo  laminas, cuadernos hasta artículos de bazar. Ella Atiende su pequeño negocio sola. Ya que comienza a trabajar desde las 8.00am hasta las 10.00pm. Al principio su zona era de mucha delincuencia y no había mucha productividad para su negocio,  pero a pasar del tiempo ha ido mejorando esas condiciones ya que ahora le va muy bien en su negocio. Su sueño es poder ampliar más su negocio para poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus consumidores que día a día le compran en su bazar. Linda quisiera arreglar su vivienda y tambien uno de sus sueño es comprarse un carro. Con el préstamo comprara  artículos para el bazar como  papeles, láminas, bolígrafos  etc.
texts.en:
Linda lives in a suburb of the city of Guayaquil.  She is married and has two children; one is four years old and the other is three years old.  

Linda bought a display case and a sales rack, and it was then that she began her business selling laminated educational sheets, notebooks, and other stationary store items.  She attends to her small business alone, and works from eight in the morning until ten at night.  At first, her area had a lot of crime and there wasn't a lot of productivity for her business.  However, with the passing of time, these conditions have improved and her business is doing well.  

Her dream is to be able to grow her business more so that she is able to meet the needs of all the customers who come to buy products every day from her stationary store.  Linda would like to fix up her home, and another one of her dreams is to buy a car for herself.  

With this loan, she will buy items for her stationary store, like paper products, laminated educational sheets, ballpoint pens, etc.

loans.use: to buy paper products, laminated educational sheets, ballpoint pens, etc.

loans.name: Songa Group

texts.en:
Basil is a single man who is in his late 20s. He has been running a telephone money transfer (Tigo Pesa, M-pesa) and game play station business. He has had this business for only six months. He works from 10:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to earn a fair profit per month.

He has requested his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he expects to increase telephone money transfers so as to provide this service to more customers. His dream is to one day be able to run a car spare parts business.

He will share this loan with his loan group, Songa, which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase purchase of telephone credit

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen sells potatoes in Nakuru Town.  He has been in the business for three years, and it has been profitable.  He is married to Grace, and they have a one year old child.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to buy more stocks of sweet potatoes to sell in his business.  He anticipates making more profits, with which he plans to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

In the future, Stephen hopes to build commercial and rental houses in the area, and to be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy  sweet  potatoes.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 44 years old and supports a family of eight. He runs a transport business (matatu) along Kabarnet, Eldoret and Nakuru routes. This has been his income generating business for the last five years, where he gets an average monthly income of KES. 30,000 from the business. 

He has borrowed a second loan of KES. 60,000 after successfully paying his previous loan. With this loan he intends to buy new tyres and spare parts for his vehicle. 

He anticipates getting profits which he will use to expand his business by buying another vehicle, as well as buy a plot and develop it. Wilson's hope and dream is to buy a plot and develop it by building rental houses to generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is a cash crop farmer in the town of Olkalau where she grows maize (corn), beans, potatoes and other vegetables.  She has been in the business for 20 years and it has been profitable. She is 61 years old, married to Evanson who is also a farmer, and they have four children.

This is her first loan and she plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and manure for use in her farm. She anticipates making more profits with which she will use to provide for the needs of her family.

In the future, Jecinta hopes to improve her farming methods such as growing in large scale, making more income, and to be able to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, and manure for use in her farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 39-year-old farmer in Kisii county, Kenya, where she lives with her husband and four children.  None of her children are being schooled.  She has been in farming for the past fifteen years producing maize (corn), beans, and bananas which she sells to the local market.

She is requesting a 31,200 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow, which she will later sell the milk and use the income to improve the family living standards and provide for the family's needs.  She aspires to open a cereal shop and to buy two good dairy cows in the next five years.

Diseases and natural calamities are her major challenges in farming.

She is very happy to be able to access loan facilities from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 25 years old. He is married to Eunice, a farmer, and together they have one child. He is a milk vendor and has been in the business for the past four years. He gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from his business.

This will be his first term loan in KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of his friends who is a registered client. He will use the loan amount to purchase stock of milk for sale. He will also purchase a bicycle to assist him in transportation.

He hopes to improve his living standard.

loans.use: Purchase stock of milk and get transportation.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is 57 years old, married to Andrew, and blessed with four children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last eight years, earning a monthly income of KES. 25,000.

Salome has applied for her first loan of KES.15,000 from KADET LTD with which she plans to buy an additional dairy cow. The anticipated profits will be reinvested and also used to help meet the family’s basic needs. Her dream is to uplift her financial status.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aura Lisbeth

texts.es: Aura vive en el suburbio de la ciudad de Guayaquil. Es casada tiene 2 hijas la mayor de 4 años que asiste a una escuela pública del sector y la menor de 2 años. Aura empezó con la venta de recargas de saldo a celulares. Ella siempre quiso tener su propio negocio.En la actualidad Aura logro su sueño porque en su casa tiene un local de bazar y papelería. Aura trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7 de la mañana a 10 de la noche. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad y juntos mantine el hogar. Con el préstamo quiere comprar artículos de bazar como cuadernos, bolígrafos, carpetas, etc. Su meta es que su local tenga un espacio mas amplio para que su negocio sea bien surtido.
texts.en: Aura lives in a suburb of the town of Guayaquil. She's married and has two daughters; the eldest one is 4 years old and attends a local public school, and the youngest one is 2 years old. Aura got her start by selling cell phone recharges. She has always wanted to own her own business. Currently Aura has accomplished her dream, because she runs a grocery and stationery store in her house. Aura works Monday through Saturday from 7 a.m. to 10 p.m. Her husband is a security guard and together they support their household. With this loan she wishes to purchase stationery items such as notebooks, pens, folders, etc. Her goal is to enlarge her store in order for her business to be well-stocked.

loans.use: to purchase notebooks, pens and folders.

loans.name: Kimanyisho

texts.en:
Kimanyisho is 48 years old, married, and blessed with six children aged 19,17,11,10, 9 and 8.  She has been running a retail shop for the last six years, getting a monthly income of 15,000 KES. 

She has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD.  She plans to restock her shop with a variety of consumable goods.

The anticipated profits will be ploughed back to the business for expansion. Her future dream is s to be successful in life

loans.use: to stock her shop with a variety of consumables

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
The motivation to improve himself is one of the most important dreams of Hamisi, who lives with his parents in the town of Msambweni. He is a single gentle man who has the desire to get ahead.

He sells fish at the market, a business he has done for the last four years. He has a lot of clientele who prefer him for the quality of the product, the accessible prices, and, above all, for the excellent service. He is an active and tenacious man who devotes himself to his work. 

He is very happy with the business, but he knows that he needs to make it grow in order to get out of poverty. He is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow him to buy more stock of fish.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Roxana Maribel

texts.es: Roxana vive en el cantón Libertad de la provincia de Santa Elena. Ella es casada tiene 2 hijos que asisten a una escuela pública cerca de su sector. Roxana comenzó con la ilusión de trabajar ya que su esposo hace varios años se había quedado sin trabajo y fue entonces que tomo la decisión empezar como comerciante de venta de ropa. Comenzo vendiendo a sus familiares después a los vecinos del sector ya que era un poco vergonzosa. Ella pensó que su negocio iba a fracasar, pero en la actualidad le va bien como  comerciante. Trabaja de lunes a  viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde. Con el préstamo quiere comprar blusas, pantalones, shorts, etc. Su meta es tener su local propio y no andar vendiendo su mercadería en la calles
texts.en:
Roxana lives in the Cantón Libertad in the Santa Elena province.  She is married, and she has two children who go to a public school that is close to her area.

Roxana started with the hope of working because her husband was left without work for several years.  That was when she made the decision to start as a merchant selling clothes.  She started selling to her relatives, and after that she sold to her neighbors in the area because she was a little bashful.

She thought that her business would fail, but at the present time it is going well for her as a merchant.  She works Mondays through Fridays from eight in the morning until five in the afternoon.

She wants to use the loan to buy blouses, pants, and shorts, etc.  Her goal is to have her own place and not have to walk around selling her merchandise on the streets.

loans.use: to buy blouses, pants, and shorts, etc.

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es: José, de 44 años, habitante de la comunidad Chacaraseca en las fueras de León, casado , padre de tres hijos todos mayores de edad . Él se dedica a la agricultura actividad que aprendió por tradición ya que su padre se dedicaba a lo mismo y creció trabajando en el campo. Al casarse se independizo se dedicó a la siembra de maíz y crianza de animales, su hijo mayor lo apoya en las labores del campo. Actualmente está emprendiendo un proyecto el cual es el engorde de cerdos negocio que es muy demandado y deja buenos ingresos. Es por tal motivo que está requiriendo el crédito para comprar cerdos de desarrollo pues esto le ayudara a diversificar su negocio y obtener nuevas formas de ingresos cuando la  siembras esta bajas. Uno de sus proyectos es lograr tener su propia granja de cerdos reproductores.
texts.en: 44-year-old José lives in the village of Chacaraseca, on the outskirts of León. He's married and has three children, all of whom are adults. He's a farmer, a trade he learned out of tradition, since his father was in the same line of work and he grew up working on a farm. When he got married, he became independent and started growing corn and raising animals. His eldest son helps him in his farming work. He's currently undertaking a project of fattening pigs, a business that is in high demand and generates good profits. That's the reason why he's requesting the loan so he can buy pigs for raising. This will help him to diversify his business and obtain new sources of income when harvests are low. One of his projects is to succeed in owning his own breeding pig farm.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Gs Los Angelitos No. 1 Group

texts.es:
La Señora Olimpia es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en la comunidad de los Angelitos al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la Compra y venta de cerdos.
Doña Olimpia el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de cerdos. Con el préstamo ella espera el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más cerdos que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea que el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar se mejore con esta inversión. Doña Olimpia en unos años espera que su negocio este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.
Digna tiene 28 años de edad  su negocio es una pulpería desde hace 6 años en la misma comunidad que Doña Olimpia.
Martha tiene 42 años de edad su negocio es la compra  y venta de gallinas desde hace 10 años en los diferente caseríos cercanos a su comunidad.
María tiene 46 año de edad su negocio es la compra y venta de cerdos y gallinas en el mercado del triunfo y caseríos cercanos a su comunidad desde hace 8 años.
Rubenia tiene 49 años de edad su negocio es la compra y venta de gallinas desde hace 8 años en su casa de habitación.

Choluteca, Honduras - Septiembre 2012
texts.en:
Sra. Olimpia is an honest, responsible, and hardworking person. She lives with her husband and their three children in the community of Los Angelitos in southern Honduras. Her business involves buying and selling pigs.

Doña Olimpia needs a loan so that she can buy pigs. With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales since she will have more pigs to offer to the customers who visit her and to meet their needs. Olimpia also wants to improve her family’s lifestyle at home with this investment. In a few years, Doña Olimpia hopes that her business will be positioned as the largest and most well-known in the area so that she can continue supporting her children. She wants them to become good people and to have better opportunities.

The other members are as follows: • Digna, age 28, opened a convenience store six years ago in the same community where Doña Olimpia lives. • Martha, age 42, has been buying and selling chickens for 10 years in the different villages near her community. • María, age 46, has a business of buying and selling pigs and chickens at the central market and in the villages near her community. She has been in business for eight years. • Rubenia, age 49, has been buying and selling chickens from her home for eight years.

Choluteca, Honduras – September 2012

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 38 years old and married to Esther.  They have four children.  He is a mixed crop farmer in Nakuru Town, where he keeps dairy cows as well as planting cash crops such as maize and beans.  Besides farming, he runs a restaurant business.

This is his first loan from  KADET LTD, and he plans to buy a motorcycle and start a transport business in Nakuru Town. He plans to use the generated profits to boost his restaurant business by buying more stocks of food such as rice, cooking oil and wheat flour.

Edward hopes to grow his farming business by planting on a large scale and making more income, thus being able to improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Elba

texts.es:
Elba, de 41 años es una mujer seria y con aspiraciones. Vive en compañía de Joel, su esposo desde hace 13 años. Ambos tienen una hija Melina, a la que cuidan en su casa propia. Sus actividades son diversas. En las mañanas desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su casa, donde hace algún tiempo abrió una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad y como mujer del campo. Ella también se dedica a la ganadería, con las 4 vacas que posee; vende la leche que produce, a un buen precio, pues son muy nutritivas de buena textura. Asimismo, siembra en sus terrenos agrícolas; avena, habas, alverja y papa. Cuenta que desde los 15 años comenzó a trabajar de manera independiente, pues tenia que ayudar a su familia, con el tiempo consolidó una propia. Por ello no descansa, al contrario desea aumentar sus ganancias, con la compra de cerdos, con los que también obtendrá ganancias. Ya que piensa ensebarlos y venderlos a los carniceros de la zona. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “Usibamba” y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Elba, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca para aumentar su ganado, pues hace poco vendió uno de sus ejemplares.
texts.en:
Elba, 41, is a serious woman with goals.  She lives with Joel, her husband of 13 years.  They have a daughter, Melina, and take care of her in their own home.  

She has a variety of jobs.  Very early in the morning she opens the doors of her house, where some time ago she started a grocery store to sell staple products.  And as a rural woman, she also makes a living in livestock with her four cows.  She sells the milk they produce at a good price because it's very nutritious and has a good texture.  She also grows crops on her land: oats, beans, peas, and potatoes.  

She says she began to work on her own when she was 15 because she had to help her family, and in time she got stronger.  That's why she doesn't rest; on the contrary, she wants to increase her earnings by purchasing pigs, from which she'll also get profits because she plans to fatten them and sell them to the butchers in the area.

She belongs to Usibamba Solidarity Group and this is her fifth loan with MFP.  She's grateful for the financial support she keeps getting.  Now she has a way to improve her business.  She pledges to be punctual with her payments because they taught her to be responsible.

Elba will invest the money requested in buying a cow to increase her cattle because she recently sold one.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Gs 3 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
La señora Miriams, tiene 48 años de edad, tiene 2 hijo que  dependen de ella y su compañero de hogar, Su actividad principal es el comercio, ella cuenta con una pulpería y a la vez se dedica  la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, Doña Miriams trabaja hace mas de 29 años en esta  actividad, ella cuenta con una buena clientela ya que sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante lo que es ropa y calzado que le genera otros ingresos.
Doña Miriams esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de productos como zapatos, pantalones, blusas, enseres, plásticos, medicina popular, manteca, arroz, azúcar, lácteos, pollo, embutidos y ropa nueva para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, con el crédito solicitado Doña  Miriams, le contribuirá a tener una mejor existencia de productos para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes ya que se aproxima la temporada de navidad y es alta en ventas lo que le permitirá obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros.
Doña Miriams uno de sus sueños es darle una excelente educación a sus hijos y un techo digno donde podan vivir.
La Señora Petrona, se dedica a la venta y elaboración de rosquillas y pan  cuenta con 27 años de experiencia.
La  Señora Luz, se dedica a la venta de granos básicos, cuenta con 12 años de experiencia en el manejo del mismo.
Ana se dedica ala venta de ropa y calzado enseres plásticos y cuenta con una experiencia de 12 años.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Miriams, age 48, has two children who are dependent upon her and her life partner.  Her main business activity is commerce.  She has a mini-market, and she also sells new clothes and shoes.

Miriams has been working at this business activity for over 29 years.  She says that she has good clientele because she sells clothes and shoes in an itinerant manner, which generates other income.

Miriams is requesting the loan to buy products like shoes, pants, blouses, household goods, plastics, popular medicine, shortening, rice, sugar, dairy products, chicken, sausages, and new clothes in order to meet her customers’ demand.

With the requested loan Miriams will have a better supply of products to meet her customers’ demand.  This is because the Christmas season is approaching, and that is a high sales season.  It will allow her to get better income to cover the family’s expenses and financial commitments. 

One of Miriams’ dreams is to give her children an excellent education and a decent roof over their heads.

Petrona makes and sells ‘rosquillas’ [a ring-shaped pastry] and bread.  She has 27 years of experience.

Luz sells basic grains.  She has 12 years of experience running this business.

Ana sells clothes, shoes, household goods, and plastics.  She has 12 years of experience.

Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - October 2012

loans.use: to buy products like shoes, pants, blouses, household goods, plastics, popular medicine, shortening, rice, sugar, dairy products, chicken, sausages, and new clothes.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old. He is divorced from his wife. He supports his four children, who are all in school. He is a farmer, and has been in the business for the past five years. He gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES from his business.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD.  He has paid his previous loan well and in good time.  He will use the loan amount to pay school fees for his children.

He hopes to educate his his children to the highest levels.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Elsa de 42 años de edad, es viuda, vive con sus tres hijos en su casa ubicada en una comunidad al sur de Honduras, ella se dedica desde hace 10 años a la venta de abarrotería, frescos, jabón, churros, agua, pollos, etc. sus ventas son con los amigos y vecinos que a diario visitan su negocio.
Doña Elsa con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para comprar Arroz, Leche, Frijoles, huevos, manteca, aceite, azúcar, café, pan, lácteos, embutidos, jabón, agua y otros productos para su negocio de esta manera tener mejores ganancias y mejorar un poco su condición de vida ya que ella es viuda y le ha tocado difícil sacar adelante a su familia. 
Doña Elsa su sueño es mejorar su negocio y darle a sus hijos una vida mejor.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Elsa, 42, is a widow.  She lives with her three children in her house in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  She has made a living for 10 years selling groceries, soda, soap, fried dough, water, chickens, etc.  She sells to friends and neighbors who come to her store every day.

With the support of this loan Elsa will supplement her financing to buy rice, milk, beans, eggs, margarine, oil, sugar, coffee, bread, dairy products, cold cuts, soap, water, and other products for her business.  This way she'll have better profits and improve her quality of life somewhat, because she's a widow and it's been difficult for her to get her family ahead.

Elsa's dream is to improve her business and give her children a better life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2012

loans.use: to buy products for her business

loans.name: Sandra Kalexa

texts.es:
Sandra, de 44 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de León, madre de 1 hijo mayor de edad, casada, de oficio comerciante. Su negocio de pulpería lo empezó con la venta de frutas, ella se convirtió en madre soltera y necesita un medio para obtener ingresos para mantener su hijo y terminar de prepararlo así que con frutas y pocos productos fue formando su pequeña pulpería la cual atiende una gran parte de su vecindario al pasar el tiempo conoció a su actual esposo que es quien la ayuda a solventar los gastos del hogar. Ella dice que no solo quiere quedarse con un pequeño negocio en lo futuro tiene la  visión de convertir su pulpería en una distribuidora de alimentos y granos básicos donde su clientela encuentre todo lo necesario para la comida. 
Está requiriendo un financiamiento para comprar arroz, aceite, azúcar, frijoles, shampo, productos lácteos, productos de limpieza, huevo , pan , jugos, gaseosas, pasta de dientes.
texts.en:
Sandra, 44, lives in the city of León and is the mother of an adult son; she’s married and is a merchant by profession.  She started her grocery store selling fruit.  She became a single mother and needed to earn income to support her son and raise him completely so with fruit and a few products she started to form her small grocery store with which she tended to most of the neighborhood.  

In time she met her current husband who helps her cover household expenses.  She says that she doesn’t just want to stay with the grocery store but rather has a future plan of turning the grocery store into a food and basic grains distributorship where her customers can find everything needed for meals.  She needs financing to buy rice, sugar, oil, beans, shampoo, dairy products, cleaning supplies, eggs, bread, juice, soft-drinks and toothpaste.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rhoda Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Rhoda” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Leones for each in the group. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Alimamy. Alimamy is age 50; he was born in Freetown, but he is currently residing in Makeni together with his wife and three children. His wife is a trader and his children are attending secondary school. 

For 17 years now, Alimamy has been a businessman. Currently, he is selling provisions – milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, etc. With this loan, he will buy milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, etc. at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, butter, mayonnaise, etc. at wholesale to add to his business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
A dynamic Fatuma has been selling household products in her retail shop for a while; thanks to her efforts, she has been able to have good income. Since the previous loan, her living standards have improved. 

She would like to strengthen her business and is therefore requesting her fourth loan from Yehu. She wants to use her profits to increase her inventory of products, open a shop and ensure her family's food self-sufficiency. 

With this investment, she will be able to buy more merchandise like flour and crates of soda, among other necessities.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like flour and crates of soda, among other necessities.

loans.name: Grace Amada

texts.es:
La Señora Grece está realizando el segundo crédito en el banco comunal Génesis, vive por el sector de Génesis en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, se encuentra rodeada de exuberante vegetación, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la Cultural y Tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Grece tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 20, 13 y 11 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija está en el colegio y su ultimo hijo se encuentra estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora. Grece es oriunda de la provincia del Oro pero por motivos de trabajo llego a Cuenca hace 13 años, labora de domingo a domingo en un restaurante que es de su propiedad hace 2 años, como es un negocio propio no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo, ella realiza una gran variedad de platos y cuando le piden también realiza bufetes.
 
Su nuevo crédito  lo va a invertir en la compra de pintura para arreglar su local y  en la compra de vajilla nueva.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo para su negocio que le hace falta.
texts.en:
Grace is undertaking her second loan in the Génesis communal bank. She lives in the Génesis sector of the city of Cuenca; a place with a cold climate, surrounded by exuberant vegetation, and since December 1999, a world heritage site. Its people are friendly, kind and still maintain the culture and traditions of their people.

Grace is 38 years of age, married and has three children ages 20, 13 and 11. Her eldest child works and helps her financially. Her second child is in school, and her youngest goes to a primary school in the city. Her husband is an employee of a private company. They don't have their own house, so they rent.

Grace is from the province of Oro. For work reasons, she came to Cuenca 13 years ago. She works from Sunday to Sunday in a restaurant which she has owned for two years. As it is her own business, she doesn't have fixed hours of work. She makes a great variety of dishes, and when requested, also does buffets.

She is going to use her new loan to buy paint for fixing her premises. and to buy new crockery.
 
Her goal is to buy a needed vehicle for her business.

loans.use: To buy paint and crockery for her restaurant.

loans.name: Mery  Antonieta

texts.es:
La Señora. Mery está realizando el tercer crédito en el banco comunal Génesis, vive por los Cerezos en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, se encuentra rodeada de exuberante vegetación, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la Cultural y Tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Mery tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de 25, 24 gemelos, 23, 20 y 9 años de edad, tres de sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, un hijo es casado y vive independiente, un hijo soltero trabaja y vive independiente, su ultima hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión mecánico latonero y tiene un taller propio, la casa en la que habita es de su propiedad.

La señora Mery se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, esta actividad la desempeña desde hace 3 años. Como es una mujer emprendedora ha iniciado con un negocio de venta de comida hace 2 meses y por el momento le va muy bien en este negocio. 

Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de cosméticos para incrementar su mercadería, en la cancelación de dicho crédito no tuvo dificultad alguna ya que ha realizado los pagos en las fechas correspondientes. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para el arreglo de su local de comida, va a comprar vajilla y mesas. La banca comunal le gusta porque existe un gran compañerismo.
texts.en:
Mery is taking out her third loan in the “Génesis” communal bank.  She lives in Los Cerezos in the city of Cuenca, a cold climate place surrounded by exuberant vegetation that’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999.  Its residents are kind, gracious and still preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

Mery’s 49-years-old, married and has had six children who are 25, 24-year-old twins, 23, 20 and 9 years of age.  Three of her children work and help her out economically, one son is married and lives independently and one son is single and lives independently.  Her youngest daughter is attending a local elementary school.  Her husband is a car body repairman and has his own shop.  The house she lives in is hers.

Mery works selling cosmetics, an activity she’s been in for the last three years.  Since she’s an enterprising woman, two months ago she started a food business and to date is doing very well in it.

She used her previous loan to buy cosmetics to increase her inventory and had no problem repaying that loan; she made all payments as scheduled.  She will use her new loan to fix up her food stand; she will buy tables and dinnerware.  She likes the communal bank because good fellowship exists in it.

loans.use: to buy tables and dinnerware.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара 54 года, воспитала двух детей. Дочь замужем, сын учится в школе. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Тамара в 1976 году начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных  продуктов и от перепродажи скота. Благодаря упорному труду Тамары, ее поголовье насчитывает 3 дойные коровы и 18 овец,и одна лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Тамара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Цель кредита является приобретение 2 голов быков. Доходы Тамара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота. В дальнейшем, как поделилась своими планами Тамара, мечтает приобрести квартиру в г.Каракол
texts.en:
Tamara is 54 years old and has raised two children. Her daughter is married and her son is studying. 

In the search of a source of income for the family, Tamara started working with livestock breeding in 1976. After having started with 5,000 som (KGS), the farm today brings in around 8,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products and from re-selling of livestock. Thanks to Tamara's hard work, the number of livestock today counts 3 dairy cows, 18 sheep and 1 horse. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Tamara turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 55,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of livestock. The purpose of the loan is to purchase two bulls. Tamara plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of livestock. In the future, according to the plans that Tamara shared with us, she dreams of purchasing an apartment in the city of Karakol.

loans.use: to purchase 2 bulls for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Ararati Group

texts.fr: La cliente Masika est membre du groupement d’affaire Ararati, elle est mariée, âgée d’environ 46 ans et mère de 7 enfants. Son mari est un agriculteur. La cliente est infirmière de formation et vendeuse de médicaments en détails. Elle est sociétaire d’une petite officine pharmaceutique. Elle commença son entreprise avec son fonds propre, alors issu de son salaire. Plus tard, elle sollicita le soutien de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec des produits pharmaceutiques (2 boites de paracétamols, 2 boites de chloramphénicols, des antis paludéens, des antis diarrhéiques, des antis inflammatoires, et autres médicaments génériques.). La cliente est confortable avec son entreprise. Le défi majeur pour son travail, c’est surtout les taxes et l’insuffisance de produits en stock. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en:
Masika is a member of the business group Ararati.  She is married and the mother of seven children.  She is about 46 years old.  Her husband is a farmer.

Masika is a nurse by training and she sells pharmaceutical products in retail quantities.  She co-manages a small pharmacy.  She started this business using her own funds, taken from her salary.  Later on, she applied for financial support from the microfinance institution Hekima.  

This new loan will be used to buy pharmaceutical products: two boxes of acetominophen, two boxes of chloramphenicol (a broad-spectrum antibiotic), antimalarial drugs, antidiarrheal, anti-inflammatories, and other generic medications).

Masika feels good about the way her business is going.  Her main challenge, however, are taxes and a low inventory.

She thanks Hekima for its support and for empowering women involved in small business.

loans.use: to buy pharmaceutical products: 2 boxes of acetominophen, 2 boxes of chloramphenicol, antimalarial, anti-diarrheal, anti inflammatory medications and other generic drugs).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: María De La Nube

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia activa del banco comunal Génesis, se encuentra realizando el sexto crédito en este banco comunal, vive por el sector del Vecino en la ciudad de Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, se encuentra rodeada de exuberante vegetación, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la Cultural y Tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. María tiene 40 años de edad, se encuentra casada y ha concebido 4 hijos de 22, 20, 13 y 10 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan para solventar sus gastos personales, sus dos últimas hijas están estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Ella es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de calzado y ropa, esta actividad la desempeña hace 9 años. Hace dos años se dedica también al alquiler de maquinaria pesada, esta actividad la realiza ya que su esposo es el propietario y ella le ayuda a administrar este negocio. Estos trabajos le permiten mejorar la economía de su hogar.
 
Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa y calzado, la cancelación de dicho crédito lo realizo en las fechas indicadas.  Su nuevo crédito también lo va a invertir en la compra de  ropa y calzado para seguir creciendo este negocio. La banca comunal le gusta ya que en cada reunión se encuentra con sus amigas y sale de su rutina diaria de trabajo.
texts.en:
María is an active member of “Génesis” communal bank and is taking out her 6th loan.  She lives in the El Vecino sector in the city of Cuenca, a cold climate place surrounded by exuberant vegetation that’s been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity since December, 1999.  Its residents are kind, gracious and still preserve the culture and traditions of its peoples.

María is 40-years-old, married and has had four children who are 22, 20, 13 and 10 years of age.  Her two oldest children work to cover their personal expenses and her two youngest daughters attend the local elementary school.   Her husband is a driver by profession and works driving a truck.   The house she lives in is hers.

She’s a merchant; she sells shoes and clothes.  She’s been in this activity for nine years.  Two years ago she also started renting heavy machinery, an activity she does because her husband owns it and she helps manage the business.  These jobs allow her to improve her home’s economy.

She used her previous loan to buy clothes and shoes and repaid the loan as scheduled.  She will also use the new loan to buy clothes and shoes to continue growing in this business.  She likes the communal bank because she meets with her girlfriends at each meeting and takes a break from her normal daily work routine.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Señor Del Cautivo Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Señor del Cautivo” en el distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba. Ya son cuatro años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades de los socios es la venta de artesanía, yeso, madera, chicha de maíz, verduras, flores, frutas y otros brindan servicios como por ejemplo albañilería y construcción. La socia Antonia vive en la ciudad de Urubamba y donde realiza sus actividades económicas, ella tiene 46 años de edad y tiene 8 hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde  vende diferentes de comestibles como; azúcar, arroz, fideos, aceite, leche, conservas, verduras, carnes, gaseosas, cigarros, rones, cerveza, jaboncillos, detergentes, huevos, papa entre otras cosas. Ya son varios años que la socia tiene el negocio de la tienda y le va excelente gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Antonia desea comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar.  

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(La socia que aparece en la parte inferior de la fotografía pidió permiso para llegar después de la reunión).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed Señor del Cautivo Communal Bank in the district and province of Urubamba. The communal bank has been operating for four years and it's well organized.  This communal bank is made up of fifteen people who are always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, with their daily efforts, provide a better future for their children. The economic activities of the members are selling crafts, plaster, wood, "chicha" [corn liquor], vegetables, flowers, and fruits, and providing services as masons or construction workers, for example.

Antonia lives in the city of Urubamba where she carries out her work.  She's 46 years old and has eight children.  She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells a variety of provisions, including sugar, rice, pasta, oil, milk, canned goods, vegetables, meat, soda, cigarettes, rum, beer, soap, detergent, eggs, and potatoes.  She has had her store for several years and it's going well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

This time Antonia wants to buy merchandise, such as sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

The members in general are grateful for this opportunity and pledge to make their various payments on time.  (The member who appears at the bottom of the photograph asked permission to arrive after the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice and sugar

loans.name: Zilola

texts.ru: Зилола давно мечтала заняться каким-нибудь видом бизнеса, но раньше у нее не было, ни средств, ни какой либо поддержки. Когда она обзавелась семьей, сама нужда заставила ее подумать не только о себе, но и о будущем детей. Посоветовавшись с мужем, она начала продавать различные виды детской одежды. Торговой точки у нее тогда не имелось, и оборот был совсем маленький. У нее хватило силы и терпения, чтобы увеличить свой оборотный капитал с помощью деятельности, поддержки мужа и родных. Вот уже 2-года Зилола продает различные виды женской одежды и обуви. Она планирует в будущем увеличить оборотный капитал, а для этого ей необходимы дополнительные инвестиции. Она раньше кредитовалась, в Имон –Интернешнл. Она обращается повторно с целью получение займа для пополнения оборотного капитала.
texts.en:
Zilola long dreamed of being engaged in some kind of business activity, but earlier she did not have the means nor the support to do it. When she started a family, it forced her to think not only of herself, but also about the future of the children. After consulting her husband, she started selling different types of children's clothing. Back then she did not have a point of sale, and the income was very small. 

Zilola had the strength and the patience to increase her turnover through activities and support from her husband and relatives. Now Zilola has been selling different types of women's clothing and shoes for 2 years. She plans to increase her turnover in the future, and for this she needs additional investments. She took a loan earlier, with IMON International. She returned again with an aim to obtain a loan for additional working capital.

loans.use: To buy goods for increasing the working capital of her business

loans.name: Amigos Por Siempre Calle Chimborazo (Montecristi) Group

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Amigos Por siempre Calle Chimborazo está integrado por 12 mujeres y 2 hombres, se reúne cada quince días en Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Este es un grupo personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que al enterarse de los beneficios que les brinda la institución decidieron unirse y formar este grupo para así mejorar los negocios que tienen.
