El señor Norlan es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y su hijo en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Don Norlan el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, frijoles, huevos, manteca, queso, pan, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, mantequilla, jabón, etc. Con el préstamo. El espera que las ventas de su negocio aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes, que lo visitan a diario y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos, con esto espera mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia.
Don Norlan en unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en la pulpería más fuerte y reconocido de la zona también que sus hijos comiencen y terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la sociedad.
Choluteca, Honduras – octubre 2012
texts.en:
Norlan is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person.  He lives with his wife and son in the south of Honduras.  His business is a grocery store. 

He is requesting this loan because he needs to purchase corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice, sugar, drinks, butter, soap, and other products.  He hopes that the sales at his business will increase when he has more products to offer to customers who visit every day to purchase their household necessities.  He hopes this will improve his family's quality of life.  

Norlan hopes that over the next few years his business will continue growing and become stronger and well known in the area.  He also hopes that his children start and finish their studies and become good people with better opportunities in society.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice, sugar, drinks, butter, soap, and other products for his store.

loans.name: Lorpu

texts.en: Lorpu, age 36, lives in Paynesville South (a suburb of Monrovia). She is married and has three children, who are between 2 and 9 years of age. Only two of the children stay with her and her husband at home, and attend school; the other child stays with Lorpu's sister. Lorpu's husband is a contractor, and he gave her the initial capital to start her business. Lorpu has a warehouse in her community, where she has been selling coal for the past nine years. A difficulty she faces is transporting the coal from the bush to Monrovia. She makes a profit when she sells, because she has customers who are always waiting to buy coal wholesale, after it has been transported to Monrovia. She has requested a loan to purchase more coal, in bulk, for the business.  Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal, in bulk, for the business.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 37 years old. She is married to Peter, and they have three children. She operates a boutique and has been in business for the past three years.

This will be her second loan from KADET LTD. She repaid her previous loan in full and on time. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase ladies' wear to sell in her shop.

She hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase ladies' wear to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine, a 34 year old mother of two children ages 11 and seven years, has a beauty salon in Naivasha Town.  She is married to Dominic, who is a businessman.  She has operated her salon business for two years now.

This being her second loan, she plans to use the amount to buy more stock of cosmetics and other beauty products such as hair chemicals, shampoo, hair oil and hair braids.  She will use the generated profits to expand her salon by employing more staff, since the number of customers has been increasing.

She hopes to grow her business by opening more beauty salons and making more income. Hence, she hopes to be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cosmetics and beauty products.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from the town of Msambweni. She is married to Hassan, and they have a 17-year-old son who is still in school. She earns her living as a clothing vendor.

She is in business thanks to her husband, a businessman, who helped her get started with a bit of his savings. Their work enables them to educate their son and buy home comforts. Mariam now has an established, responsible, clientele. She herself is a very responsible person with a desire to succeed.

Mariam is seeking a loan to buy a variety of clothing, such as t-shirts, blouses, jeans, etc., so her business will be better stocked.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing, such as t-shirts, blouses, jeans, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua is a petty trader. She sells cosmetics, accessories, panties and underwear, at Agona, near Takoradi. She has done this work for eight years. She is a single parent with three children, and as a single parent, she uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. Afua will use her loan to purchase more accessories, cosmetics and underwear to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase more accessories, cosmetics and underwear to sell.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
El joven Sergio es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería. Sergio el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: café, maíz, frijoles, huevos, manteca, queso, pan, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, mantequilla, jabón, etc. Con el préstamo El espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan a diario y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con mejores precios, con esto mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Sergio en unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en la pulpería más grande y conocido de la zona y que su familia sigua viviendo con el estilo de vida y que sus hijos comiencen y terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades para la sociedad.
Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre del  2012
texts.en:
Young Sergio is a responsible, hardworking, and honest person, who lives with his wife and two children in the south of Honduras.  He has a store and is seeking a loan to buy coffee, corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice, sugar, soft drinks, butter, soap.  He hopes that with the loan he can grow sales by offering his daily customers more products at better prices.  That way he can improve his family's quality of life at home.  

Over the next few years Sergio wants to keep growing the business and turn it into the biggest and best-known in the area so he family can maintain their lifestyle and his children can start and finish their educations and grow into good people with better opportunities in society.

loans.use: to buy coffee, corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice, sugar, soft drinks, butter, soap, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Francisco Jonas

texts.es:
El señor Francisco  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Don Francisco el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, frijoles, huevos, manteca, queso, pan, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, mantequilla, jabón, etc. Con el préstamo El espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan a diario y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos con esto mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Don Francisco en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en la  pulpería  más grande y conocida de la zona y que su familia sigua adelante para mejorar el estilo de vida. También desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades para la  sociedad.
Choluteca, Honduras –  Octubre  2012
texts.en:
Francisco is a responsible, hard-working, and honest person.  He lives with his wife and two children in the south of Honduras.  His business is a grocery store.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice, sugar, drinks, butter, soap, and other items.  He hopes that sales in his store increase when he has more products to offer to customers who visit daily to purchase the necessities for their household.  He hopes that this will improve his family's quality of life.  

Francisco hopes that over the next few years his business continues to grow and becomes the largest and most well known in the area so that his family can continue improving their quality of life.  He hopes that his children finish their studies and become good people with more opportunities in society.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice, sugar, drinks, butter, soap, and other products for his business.

loans.name: Namvatuni

texts.en:
Namvatuni, who is 30 years old, is married to Edward and supports a family of five. She is a livestock farmer. She has been in business for the past five years. Her monthly income is KES 20000.
She is currently requesting her first loan, of KES 20000, from KADET, which will facilitate her purchase of more livestock for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into crop farming. Her future dream is to improve the standard of living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for resale.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is from Telavi district of East Georgia. He is 37 years old and lives with his wife, parents, brother and two children. Teimuraz’s parents are pensioners. The family runs an animal husbandry business. In particular, they have four cows and two calves. The family uses the milk for dairy products. They produce yogurt and sell it at the local open market. Besides his agricultural activities, Teimuraz works as an artisan and gets a monthly income.

Teimuraz owns a car and serves the local people as a taxi driver. He is a very hard-working man, with a rich experience in his work. Teimuraz requested a loan to repair and maintain his car. It is damaged now, and he is forced to stop the taxi business. After the car is repaired, he'll be able to resume this work and give his customers better service. This will increase the family's income, and Teimuraz will improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to repair the car he uses as a taxi.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, a mother of five children, runs a cafeteria business in Nakuru town. She used her previous loan amount to buy cooking pots and utensils for use in the business. It has been profitable, and she was able to repay all of the loan amount well and in good time.

This is her second loan cycle, and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of cooking oil and rice, as well as both maize and wheat flours. She also plans to buy some iron sheets and build a shed outside the cafeteria, so as to accommodate more customers.

Teresia hopes to expand her business, to make more income, and to open a bigger restaurant in town. She also hopes to build commercial and rental houses.

loans.use: To buy more stock of cooking fat, rice, maize and wheat flours, to use in her cooking for her cafeteria.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 23 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail store, which sells sugar, oil, and posho. 

To help expand her business, Sarah is requesting a loan for 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda, which she will use to buy rice, maize flour, soap, and salt. This loan will help her generate greater profits and increase her capital. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy rice and maize flour.

loans.name: Yahve Yire Group

texts.es: Cordiales Saludos desde Perú!!! Este es el grupo “Yahve Yire” conformados por 06 socios responsables y trabajadoras que pasan a su 5to ciclo. Luis es una señor  de 43 años. Hace años atrás se dedicó a la venta de pecanas, garbanzos y pallares, conjunto con su esposa quienes tuvieron que dejar su tierra Ica por causa de un gran terremoto que los afectó; emprendieron una nueva vida en la capital, atravesó situaciones difíciles; con mucho esfuerzo pudieron adquirir su vivienda propia con los prestamos que solicitaron de dos bancos, y hace seis meses puso una pequeña tienda en su vivienda que espera hacerlo crecer con su esfuerzo. Sus ingresos le ayudaron que sus tres hijos estudien. Su sueño es verlos convertidos en profesionales. El crédito lo requiere para la inversión de arroz, aceite, azúcar, y leche es lo que necesita por el momento para implementar más su tiendita. Posteriormente comprará una computadora más para sus hijos debido a la necesidad de sus estudios. Está seguro de lograr sus propósitos con la ayuda de Dios, los inversionistas y su esfuerzo.  Luis es el primero del lado derecho viste una camisa marón a cuadros.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru!

This is the “Yahve Yire” group; it has six responsible, hardworking members who are going through their 5th cycle.  Luis is a 43-year-old man who used to sell pecans, garbanzo beans and lima beans.  He and his wife had to leave their home in Ica because of a great earthquake that affected them.  They started a new life in the capital.  He went through difficult times and with much effort they were able acquire their own home with loans they requested from two banks.  Six months ago he opened a small store at home that he hopes to make grow through his efforts.  His income helped his three children go to school.  His dream is to see them become professionals.

He needs the loan to buy rice, oil, sugar and milk which is what he needs to stock his little store.  Later on, he’ll buy another computer for his children that’s needed for their school work.  He’s confident that he will reach his goals with help from God, lenders and his own effort.  Luis is first from the right wearing a brown checked shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is married and has four children.

To earn a living, she sells various grocery and food/drink items, including kenkey, powerded milk, toffees, powered pepper, canned tomatoes, and canned fish, at Adum Bansu near Takoradi. Ernstina has operated this business for four years. She uses her business income to assist her husband pay their utility bills.

She is now seeking a loan so that she can buy groceries and food/drink items (e.g., milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish) to satisfy her customers and to meet their demands. She hopes to use the additional profits she expects to generate from the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business and to meet customers' demands by purchasing groceries and food/drink items such as milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es:
Doña María es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo en el  caserío san Juan, Choluteca. Su negocio es la venta de refrescos y gaseosas.
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: gatorade y gaseosas. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer a sus y poder cubrir los pedidos que estos le hacen a diario, así mismo con el aumento de los ingresos mejorar el estilo de vida del hogar y de la familia. En unos años Doña María espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más grande y conocido de la zona y a su vez que su familia viva de una manera digna y sin preocupaciones.

Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2012
texts.en:
María is a very responsible, honest and hardworking woman living with her husband in the San Juan settlement, Choluteca.  Her business is selling soft-drinks.  María needs the loan to buy Gatorade and soft-drinks.  She hopes her sales will increase with the loan because she’ll have more products on sale and will be able to fill orders she gets daily.  Also, with the increase in income she’ll be able to improve her home’s and her family’s lifestyle.  María hopes her business will grow in a few years and become the largest, best-known in the zone and at the same time that her family will live with dignity and worry-free.

Choluteca, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy Gatorade and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane used her previous loan to buy vegetables for resale. It was successful and she was able to pay all the loan amount back and in good time. Besides the vegetable business, she also sells timber in Nakuru town.

With her second loan, she plans to buy more timber to sell. Due to the high demand of timber from the construction sites within the town, she anticipates to generate more profits with which she will pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to grow her business by opening a hardware store, earn more income, and be able to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buy timber for resale

loans.name: Jaidy B.

texts.en: Jaidy B., 36, is a university student. She lives with her friend in Paynesville South. She has two children that are 16 and 19 years old. Only one of her children stays with her and attends school. The other child lives with his father. For the past ten years she has been selling imported blouses, dresses, and slippers. She started by selling coal in the community, before getting into clothing sales. Because of the quality material that she sells, she makes a profit every day. She uses the profit to improve the business and to help with the household expenses. She has requested her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more imported blouses, dresses, and slippers for the business. Her dream for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more imported blouses, dresses, and slippers

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 40-year-old, married man. He is blessed with three children between the ages of five and 12 years old.

To earn a living, he operates a clothing stall. He has been operating the business for eight years, and he typically earns a monthly income of approximately 15,000 KES.

He is seeking his first loan, in the amount of 15,000 KES, from KADET LTD so that he can purchase more clothing for the business. The anticipated profits he expects to generate from the loan proceeds will be used to pay school fees for his children. He dreams of improving his family's living conditions and owning a residential plot of land.

loans.use: to expand his business by purchasing additional clothes for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
Doña Simona es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable, vive con  sus 2 hijos en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una venta  de  golosinas.
Doña Simona el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: carnes, maíz y condimentos etc. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más producto para cubrir los pedidos de los clientes que visitan a diario en su negocio, ya que ella tiene su puesto en una aduana y es muy visitado a diario, con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar ella y su familia podrán tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Doña Simona en el futuro espera contar con un mejor espacio físico para poder vender  en  una  glorieta ya que en los momentos no cuenta con esto así poder seguir apoyando a su familia. Y  a sus hijos en sus estudios.
Choluteca, Honduras – octubre  2012
texts.en:
Simona’s an honest, hardworking, responsible woman living with her two children in southern Honduras.  Her business is selling snacks.  She needs the loan to buy meat, corn, condiments, etc.  She hopes her sales will increase with the loan because she’ll have more products on hand to fill orders for customers that visit her stand daily since her stand is located at customs and it’s much visited every day.  With her increase in income at home she and her family will be able to have a better quality of life.

In future, Simona would like to have an actual physical space to be able to sell at a traffic circle because at the moment she does not have one and she’d be able to continue supporting her family this way and supporting her children’s schooling.

Choluteca, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Mamacha Rosario - Huancarani Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Mamacha Rosario” en el distrito de Huancarani de la provincia del Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas principal de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, elaboración de muebles de madera, venta de artesanía, venta de productos de primera necesidad, venta de combustibles, venta de chicha y cerveza, crianza de animales menores y otras actividades. 

Victoria continúa en el banco comunal y su económica principal de la Victoria es la venta de combustibles como gasolina y petróleo, ella continua con tienda de venta de combustibles y lubricantes pero también se dedica a la agricultura y siembra papa y cebada, ella compra combustibles de uno de los grifos cercanos a la ciudad de Huancarani. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Victoria requiere el préstamo para comprar lubricantes y aditivos. Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las personas que aparecen en la parte izquierda de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors form the body of the communal bank “Mamacha Rosario” in the district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo and department of Cusco. This communal bank is made up of people who are searching continuously for opportunities to get ahead, and to bring a better future to their children through their daily efforts.  The primary business activities of the members are, for example: food sales, creation of wooden furniture, sales of crafts, a grocery store, fuel sales, beer and chicha (a fermented corn drink) sales, farming of small domesticated animals, and much more.

Victoria remains a member of the communal bank and her primary economic success has been in the sales of fuels like gasoline and oil.  She continues to run a shop where she sells fuels and lubricants, but she also does agricultural work and grows potatoes and barley.  She buys fuels from one of the outlets near the city of Huancarani.  IT has now been several years since she began this business, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort she puts into her work.  At this time, Victoria is in need of a loan to buy lubricants and additives.  The members as a whole are thankful for the opportunity that has been offered and promise to make payments of each of their different loans on schedule as arranged.  (The people who appear on the left-hand side of the photo arrived late to the meeting of the communal banking group.)

loans.use: to buy lubricants and additives.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty lives with her husband and their four children at Adum Bandu near Takoradi. Her husband is a farmer.

Gifty operates the pictured grocery shop, where she sells items like powerded milk, toffees, powdered pepper, canned tomatoes, and canned fish. Gify has been in this business for three years. She explains that she uses her business income to assist her husband pay their utility bills.

She is requesting a loan to purchase various grocery and food/drink items, such as milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish, so that she can satisfy her customers and meet their demands. She hopes to use the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business and satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional grocery and food/drink items (e.g., milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish)

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah lives with her husband and their four children at Adum Bandu near Takoradi. Her husband is a farmer.

To earn a living, Hannah works as a trader, selling various grocery and food/drink items such as powdered milk, coffee, powdered pepper, canned tomatoes, and canned fish. Hannah has been in this business for five years. She explains that she uses her business income to assist her husband pay their utility bills.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional inventory, including milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish, so that she can satisfy her customers and meet their demands. She hopes to use the additional profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand her business and to satisfy customer demand by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, and canned fish)

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI  est constitué de six femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier HEREMAKONO NORD de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de friperies et  de céréales.
ASSAN, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première femme dans la photo de la gauche vers la droite.  Elle fait l’achat vente des habits  et des grains toutes sortes et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 colis de friperie avec les commerçants de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 32 500FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi consists of six women, all of whom are married, and who have a mean age of 28 years and and average of three children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, cowives, brothers and sons. They live in the Hérémakono Nord district of the city Bougouni. They are linked through ties of vicinity, friendship and commerce. In order to strengthen their financial capacity and with the goal of improving their businesses, they joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are currently on their second loan cycle. The previous loan was paid in full. This group of women are merchants of used clothing and grain.

Assan, the group's president, is shown standing on the far left in the photo. She is a merchant who deals in used clothing and all types of grain. With her portion of the loan, she plans to purchase three parcels of used clothing from merchants in Bamako. Assan does business at the market and from her home, where she retails her goods for cash and on credit to a clientele composed mainly of women. Assan expects to make an average monthly income of 32,500 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business as well as repay her loan.

loans.use: to purchase used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kantu De San Jeronimo Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Kantu de San Jeronimo” en el distrito de Cusco de la provincia del Cusco del Departamento del Cusco. Ya son varios años que funciona el banco comunal y está bien organizado. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta desayunos, venta de comida y venta de comestibles otros socios se dedican a la brindar servicio de turismo y educación. 

Alcira nació en la ciudad del Acomayo pero vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relacion tiene dos hijos, ella se dedica a vender productos nutricionales a diferentes personas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Alcira requiere el préstamo para uso personal para alimentación de sus hijos. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the communal bank “Kantu de San Jeronimo” in the district of Cusco province of Cusco of the department of Cusco. It has been several years that this communal bank has been going, and it is very well organized.  This communal bank is made up of people who are searching continuously for opportunities to get ahead, and to bring a better future to their children through their daily efforts.  The primary business activities of the members are, for example: selling breakfast foods, an eatery, grocery sales, and other members work in the fields of tourism and education.

Alcira was born in the city of Acomayo but now lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She is married, and the result of this beautiful relationship is that they have two children.  She sells nutritional products to different people as her business.  It has been several years since she began this business, and it is going very well for her.  At the moment, Alcira needs a loan for personal use in order to feed her children.

The members as a whole are thankful for the opportunity that has been offered and promise to make payments of each of their different loans on schedule as arranged.

loans.use: to use this for feeding her children.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo de 49 años está especializada en el comercio de calzado para damas. Ella tiene 5 años de experiencia con el negocio, el que decidió iniciar porque tiene una amiga en Bucaramanga, otra ciudad de Colombia, que tiene una fábrica de calzado y aprovecha esta relación para generar ingresos. De allí,Bucaramanga, Consuelo recibe calzado que vende a vecinos y amigos y a referídos por esta clientela. 
Consuelo está aplicando a su primer crédito de Kiva, para comprar sandalias en todas las líneas de damas, y también para comprar bolsos. Ella espera con esta inversión ampliar  el volumen de sus ventas y disminuir costos, por comprar de contado y al por mayor. Algún día, a Consuelo le gustaría fabricar sus propios zapatos para vender al por mayor y seguir beneficiando a su familia en la que existe un hijo de 26 años y su cónyuge. En la actualidad está en el proceso de mejorar su vivienda, y espera  mayores ingresos para poder con  este crédito ganar dinero y mas adelante terminar las ampliaciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 49 years old. She specializes in the sale of women's footwear. She has five years of experience in this business, which she decided to start because she has a friend in Bucaramanga, another city in Colombia, who owns a footwear factory. She uses this relationship to her advantage to generate profits. Consuelo receives the footwear from Bucaramanga and sells the shoes to neighbors, friends, and customers who are referred to her by these clients.

Consuelo will use her first loan from Kiva to buy sandals from women's footwear lines, as well as to buy handbags. She hopes that this investment will help her to increase the volume of her sales and to decrease her costs, since she will be able to buy the merchandise wholesale and in cash. 

One day, Consuelo would like to make her own shoes to sell wholesale, and to continue to benefit her family. She has a 26-year-old son and a husband. Currently, she is in the process of improving her home, and she is waiting for a better income. She hopes to continue to earn money with this loan, and eventually to finish the expansion of her house.

loans.use: to buy sandals from women's footwear lines, as well as handbags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Waldina Beatris

texts.es:
La señora Waldina tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera, reside en compañía de su madre y hermanos en una comunidad urbana del municipio de San Pedro Sula, Departamento de Cortés.
Waldina  hace 7 años decidió establecer un negocio de venta de verduras y legumbres, para lo cual ella dispone de un local apto para las ventas. Ella vende pataste, yuca, plátano, malanga, zanahoria, papas.
Se vio motivada a establecer dicho negocio para lograr independencia económica y contribuir con el sostenimiento de su madre y hermanos.
Waldina ha solicitado un préstamo por la cantidad de 20,000 Lempiras, los que piensa utilizar en la compra de  mayor variedad y cantidad de verduras como habichuelas, cebolla, chiles, coliflor y papas.
Ella manifiesta estar muy agradecida con el apoyo financiero brindado ya que de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos que le permitirán crecer en su negocio y seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Waldina, 24, is single living with her mother and siblings in an urban community in the municipality of San Pedro Sula, Cortés Department.  Seven years ago Waldina decided to open a vegetable and legume business; she has a stand that’s apt for sales.  She sells chayote, manioc, bananas, taro root, carrots and potatoes.  She was motivated to start said business in order to attain economic independence and to help support her mother and siblings.

Waldina has requested a 20,000 Lempira loan to buy a wider variety and larger amounts of vegetables like kidney beans, onions, chilies, cauliflower and potatoes.  She states that she’s very grateful for the financial support provided because she’ll be able to improve her income this way that will make it possible for her business to grow and for her to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and legumes.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia  lives together with the husband, who is a farmer, and 4 children at AdumBandu, near Takoradi.  She operates the grocery shop in the picture above. She sells items like powdered milk, coffee, pepper, canned tomatoes, and canned fish. Lydia  has been involved in this business for 4 years. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to purchase groceries like milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish, and food items to satisfy her customers. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase groceries like milk, powdered milk, tomatoes, cooking oil, canned fish, and other items.

loans.name: Emma Rosa

texts.es: Emma tiene 63 años y trabaja en la venta de productos medainte guias especializadas o por catálogos. Su experiencia comercial data desde hace 20 años, pues Emma trabajó en la venta de chance, y hace 10 años se enfermó y fue operada – no pudo seguir trabajando en chance porque debió quedarse en su casa. En este momento, llegó una promotora a su casa ofriendole la posibilidad de obtener ingresos sin tener que salir de su su hogar y ella aprovechó esta oportunidad e inició su propia aventura de negocios. Ahora, Emma vende productos de sus catálogos, como perfumes, cremas, ropa interior y exterior, a sus vecinos y entre amigos, con los que ha construído una buena clientela; su meta de crecimiento no puede cumplirla sola, pues su capital d etrabajo resulta insuficiente para lograr su propósito, esta es la razón por la cual  está acudiendo a un crédito de Kiva,  con el que comprará más de estos productos, para mantener un stock de mercancía e incrementar sus ventas de perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa interior, vestidos de baño, y blusas. En el futuro, a ella le gustaría adquirir vitrinas para adecuar su negocio. Emma es un buen miembro de familia tiene un hijo de 34 años y  le gustaría ayudar a una nieta con sus estudios universitarias también.
texts.en:
Emma, 63, works selling products via specialized guidebooks or via catalogue.  She has 20 years’ commercial experience because she worked selling lottery tickets but ten years ago got sick and had to have surgery and couldn’t continue selling lottery tickets because she had to stay home.  At that time, a promoter visited her and offered her the opportunity to earn income without having to leave home and she took advantage of this opportunity and started her own business venture.  

Now, Emma sells products from her catalogues like perfume, cream, underwear and outerwear to friends and neighbors among whom she’s formed a good clientele.  She can’t meet her growth goals alone because her working capital is insufficient to do so which is why she’s calling on a Kiva loan to buy more products to have stock available and increase her sales of perfume, cream, cosmetic, underwear, bathing suits and blouses.  

In the future, she’d like to acquire display cases to furnish her business.  Emma’s a good family member.  She has a 34-year-old son and she’d also like to help with her granddaughter’s university.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, underwear, bathing suits and blouses.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old and blessed with two children. He is a dairy farmer in the Bomet area and has been running his business for the past six years, making a monthly income of 20,000 KES.

He has borrowed a second loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD; he intends use it to purchase animal feed for his cattle. 

He will invest the anticipated profit  in his business. His future dream is to improve his living standards

loans.use: to buy feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Panty Tikas De Huayllabamba Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Panty Tikas De Huayllabamba” en la comunidad de Huayllabamba distrito de Huancarani de la provincia del Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas principal de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de comida, elaboración de muebles de madera, venta de artesanía, venta de productos de primera necesidad, venta de combustibles, venta de chicha y cerveza, crianza de animales menores y otras actividades. 

Francisco vive en la comunidad de Huayllabamba y donde realiza sus diferentes actividades económicas, él es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene cuatro hijos, el es albañil y chófer. Ya son varios años que se dedica a estas actividades y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Su esposa se dedica a la compra y venta de productos secos y de esta forma ayuda a la casta familiar.  En esta Francisco requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento del carro desea comprar pistones, lubricantes y otras cosas más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. (Las personas que aparecen en la parte inferior de la fotografía llegaron tarde a la reunión del banco comunal).
texts.en:
A group of friends and neighbors formed the communal bank “Panty Tikas De Huayllabamba” in the community of Huayllabamba, district of Huancarani in the province of Paucartambo of the department of Cusco. This communal bank is made up of people who are searching continuously for opportunities to get ahead, and to bring a better future to their children through their daily efforts. The primary business activities of the members are, for example: food sales, the creation of wooden furniture, craft sales, grocery sales, sales of chicha (a traditional corn beverage) and beer, raising small animals, and other activities.

Francisco lives in the community of Huayllabamba, and that is where he does his different types of work.  He is married, and the result of this beautiful relationship has been four children.  He is both a mason and a taxi driver.  It has been several years since he began this business, and it is going very well for him, thanks to the effort he puts into his work.  His wife works in buying and selling dry goods and in this way, she helps out the whole family.  Thus, Francisco needs a loan to do maintenance on the car, as he wants to buy pistons, grease, and other items.



The members as a whole are thankful for the opportunity that has been offered and promise to make payments of each of their different loans on schedule as arranged.  (The people who appear at the bottom of the photo arrived late to the meeting of the communal bank.)

loans.use: to do maintenance on a car, hoping to buy pistons, lubricants, and other items.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes tiene 65 años y es la madre de 4 hijos que hoy están en edad adulta. Ella es comerciante y vende variedades de productos,  como sábanas, bolsos, cosméticos, juguetes, y cervezas a sus clientes, que son principalmente vecinos del sector y de otros barrios, quienes se han convertido en compradores  fijos y recomiendan clientes ocasionales, los que también diariamente aumentan sus ventas. Mercedes tiene 17 años de experiencia en esta actividad, e inició su negocio en el año 2006, pues antes de él, tenia una frutera en su casa. En la actualidad está aplicando a  un crédito, con el cual quiere comprar  cervezas, sabanas, bolsos, cosméticos, juguetes y más productos al por mayor y de contado, para genera una buena oferta en este último bimestre donde las fiestas familiares aumentan el consumo. Con estas compras, Mercedes  logrará mayor liquidez, aumentará su capital de trabajo, así como sus ventas y utilidades, porque esta es justamente su meta y con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, iniciará en el logro de su propósito.
texts.en:
Mercedes, 65, is the mother of four children who are all adults now.  She’s a merchant.  She sells a variety of products like sheets, bags, cosmetics, toys and beer to her customers who are mainly local neighbors and from adjacent neighborhoods who have become regular buyers and who recommend other customers occasionally who also increase her sales daily.

Mercedes has 17 years’ experience in this activity and started her business in 2006 because before that she had a fruit stand at home.  She’s currently applying for a loan to buy beer, sheets, bags, cosmetics, toys and other products at wholesale and for cash in order to be well-stocked for the last two months of the year when family parties increase consumption.  Mercedes will attain greater liquidity with these purchases and will increase both her working capital and her sales and profits because this is precisely her goal.  With her Kiva loan, first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, she’s start to reach her goal.

loans.use: to pay cash for and buy beer, sheets, tote bags, cosmetics, toys and other products at wholesale.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru:
Иноят, женщина в возрасте 51 года, замужем, имеет троих детей.   В 1995 года она начинала свой бизнес с мелкого оборота и развивала постепенно. С 2003 года она начала сотрудничать  с  Арванд и до сих пор кредитуется в этой организации.  Иноят занимается торговлей женской и детской одежды.  Торгует  она  на центральном рынке своего села.   Иноят два раза в неделю ездит за товаром в город .  Ее муж преподаватель и преподает в школе. Их семья очень дружелюбная.  Она планирует расширить свой бизнес для того чтобы улучшить свои условия  проживания. Их основной доход от продажи одежды, поэтому Иноят хочет расширить свой бизнес и на полученный кредит планирует закупить новый ассортимент женской и детской одежды.  Иноят очень признательна Арванд за поддержку и понимание.



















.
texts.en:
Inoyat, a 55 year-old woman, is married and has three children. In 1995 she started her business with a small sales turnover, and developed it gradually. Since 2003 she began to work with Arvand and is still receiving loans from this organization. Inoyat sells women's and children's clothing at her village's central market. Twice a week she travels to the city to buy products. Her husband is a school teacher. Their family is very friendly. Inoyat plans on expanding her business to improve her family's standard of living. Clothing sales are their main source of income, so Inoyat wants to expand her business and plans on using the loan to buy a new assortment of women's and children's clothing. Inoyat is very grateful to Arvand for their support and understanding. 



















.

loans.use: to buy women's and children's clothing

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Señora Cristina tiene 47 años y vive con sus dos hijos en las edades  de 14 y 21 años,  en Puerto Colombia, un pueblo en la costa Caribe de Colombia,. Ella tiene un café internet equipado con 2 computadores y una fotocopiadora-impresora. También, vende minutos a teléfonos celulares, recargas, chips, planes y equipos de teléfono celular. Además, comercializa mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos o catálogos, por la cual tiene una vitrina con productos que compra en promoción de varias marcas. Hace 2 años, ella resultó afectada con una inundación en su casa, y perdió algunos computadores, mercancía y varios muebles y electrodomésticos del hogar. Enfrentada a este gran desafío, ella siguió trabajando y ahora le va muy bien en su negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará mercancías para su venta, productos  de misceláneas como perfumes, cremas, y cosméticos. La señora Cristina, quiere aprovechar la temporada alta de fin de año, en que muchos clientes compran mercancías de los catálogos, como regalos navideños, lo cual hace que su inversión proyecte ser exitosa. Sus metas para el negocio son su ampliación, y el sueño familiar  de ella es comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
Cristina is 47 years old and lives with her two children, who are 14 and 21 years of age, in Puerto Colombia, a town on the Caribbean coast of Colombia.  She has an internet cafe equipped with two computers and a photocopier/printer.  She also sells cell phone minutes, SIM cards, plans, and other cell phone equipment.  She also sells merchandise out of specialized guides or catalogs, so she has a glass cabinet which can be bought on special from various companies.  

Two years ago, she was affected by a flood in her home and lost some computers, merchandise, and various pieces of furniture and household appliances.  Faced with the great disaster, she continued working, and now things are going very well in her business.  Currently, she is applying for a micro-loan, with which she will buy merchandise for her store, miscellaneous products like perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.  Cristina wants to take advantage of the buying season at the end of the year, when many customers buy items out of catalogs as Christmas gifts, which will probably make her investment quite successful.  Her goal for her business is to expand, and her personal goal is to buy her own house.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her shop, miscellaneous products like perfumes, creams, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Julieth Paola

texts.es: Julieth de 25 años vende electrodomésticos, utensilios de cocina, y mercancías varias. Ella lleva sus productos a varios barrios en la ciudad de Barranquilla para ofrecerlos a crédito una parte y la otra de contado. Julieth está separada, y tiene un hijo de 2 años, pero el padre de su hijo la impulsó a empezar este negocio hace 3 años y ella sigue vendiendo sus productos hasta ahora, con el fin de sostener ingresos que beneficien a su hogar. Julieth está aplicando a un préstamo de Kiva para comprar planchas, mesas de planchar, ollas de presión, y sanducheras, entre otros electrodomésticos menores. Sus clientes han pedido estos productos y ella sabe que puede venderlas, especialmente en esta época en la cual hay mucho dinero circulante Su meta de hacer crecer su negocio no se detiene, porque en el momento es bastante pequeño y es madre soltera y cabeza de familia, y debe impulsar el bienestar de su creatura.
texts.en:
Julieth, 25, sells small home appliances, kitchen utensils and assorted merchandise.  She takes her wares to various neighborhoods in Barranquilla to sell some on credit and some for cash.  Julieth is separated and has a two-year-old son.  Her son’s father encouraged her to start this business three years ago and she continues selling her products to date aiming at earning income for her home’s benefit.

Julieth is applying for a Kiva loan to buy irons, ironing boards, pressure cookers and sandwich presses among other small home appliances.  Her customers have requested these items and she knows she can sell them, especially during this season when there is much cash in circulation. Her goal is to make the business grow; she does not slow down because it’s currently quite small and she’s a single mother, head of household and must push for her child’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy irons, ironing boards, pressure cookers and other small home appliances.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира пришла в МДО "Арванд" чтобы  получить кредит для проведения свадьбы брата.    Она в возрасте 40 лет. Замира  работает в школе лаборанткой, и получаемая заработная плата не достаточна для проведения свадьбы.    Ее брат часто ездит  в  Российскую федерацию на заработки  и копит на свою свадьбу.    В этом году он решил жениться но у него не достаточно денежных средств и Замира решила помочь брату провести свадьбу.   На полученный кредит Замира хочет купить приданное своему брату и невестке .   Она очень любит своего брата и не может оставить его в трудном положении.   Замира очень благодарна таким организациям как Арванд за финансовую поддержку и понимание.
texts.en: Zamira has come to MDO Arvand to receive a loan to help pay the costs of hosting her brother's wedding. Zamira is 40 years old and works in a school as a laboratory assistant, but her salary is not sufficient to allow her to cover the costs of the wedding. Her brother often goes to the Russian Federation to earn money and has been saving up for his wedding. This year, he has decided to get married but does not have enough to pay all wedding costs, so Zamira has decided to help him. She plans to use the loan to buy gifts for her brother and his fiancée. She loves her brother and cannot leave him in this difficult situation. Zamira is very grateful to organizations like Arvand for their financial support and understanding.

loans.use: to buy gifts for her brother's wedding

loans.name: Luis Francisco

texts.es: Luis de 33 años, trabaja en la venta de comidas rápidas y pollo asado. A él le enseñó su hermano a preparar  comidas rápidas pues tenía una pizzería;  allí, aprendió preparar hamburguesas, perros calientes, sándwiches, salchipapas y pollo asado. Hace 3 años, empezó vendiendo hamburguesas, perros calientes y sándwiches directamente al consumidor, todos los días entre las 4 y 11 de la tarde. Con este negocio le ha ido bien  y quiere hacerlo crecer, por eso acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  para  comprar  una vitrina de autoservicio en acero inoxidable. Él piensa que esta inversión mejorará el negocio por ofrecer mejor presentación e higiene en la exhibición de su comida. Luis espera con este crédito, podrá ampliar y mejorar el nivel de sus ventas e ingresos. Pues es un bien miembro de familia  y tiene un hijo de 6 años y una hija de 4 años, y su sueño familiar más importante es poder educar con calidad a sus hijos y también tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
Luis is 33 years old and works selling fast food and roasted chicken.  His brother taught him how to prepare fast food, while he owned a pizzeria.  There he learned to make hamburgers, hot dogs, sandwiches, salchipapas (sausage and fries), and roast chicken.  Three years ago, he started selling hamburgers, hot dogs, and sandwiches directly to consumers every day between the hours of 4pm and 11pm.

With this business, he has done very well, and he wants to make his shop grow, so he has chosen to ask for a micro-loan, the first time he has taken out a loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, so he can buy a self-serve food bar made of stainless steel.  He thinks that this investment will improve his business and offer a better presentation and greater hygiene while showing off his foods.  Luis hopes that with this loan he will be able to extend and improve his sales and profits.  He is also a good family member and has a 6 year old son and a 4 year old daughter.  His most important dream for his family is to give his children a good quality education and also to have a house of their own.

loans.use: to buy a self-serve foods bar made of stainless steel.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca sells fanti kenkey at Adum Banso, which is near Takoradi. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Rebecca has been selling fanti kenkey for many years now. She uses her income to support her husband and to pay for their children's school fees. Her loan will be used to buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize for the production of her kenkey to sell

loans.name: Yexenia

texts.es: Yexenia de 34 años, vive al sur de la ciudad con su hijo de 13 años y dos hijas de 15 y 10; con ellos  tiene la  meta familiar, de darles estudios de calidad a sus hijos, para que logren ser finalmente exitosos. Ella se especializa en la venta de ropa, calzado y electrodomésticos, lo cual realiza directamente entre una clientela que ha construido poco a poco. Su negocio ha sido típico en su familia por muchos años, por eso ella aprendió de sus padres a dedicarse al comercio. Yexenia inició este negocio hace 4 años, y trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, vendiendo ropa y otros productos a sus amigos y familiares. Sus compras las realizan en  almacenes en el centro de Barranquilla y los vende a crédito; en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, para comprar ropa para damas, jeans, calzado femenino, electrodomésticos y víveres. porque quiere aumentar su surtido para ampliar sus ventas y aumentar su clientela
texts.en:
Yexenia, age 34, lives south of the city with her 13 year old son and her two daughters, ages 15 and 10.  She has a family goal to give her children a high quality education so that they can eventually be successful.

She specializes in selling clothes, shoes, and domestic appliances.  She sells directly to her clientele, which she has built up little by little.  This has been a traditional business in her family for many years.  Therefore, she learned to work in commerce from her parents.  

Yexenia started this business four years ago.  She works selling clothes and other products to her friends and relatives every day from seven in the morning until seven at night.  She makes her purchases from warehouses in the center of Barranquilla.  She sells on credit.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan in order to buy women’s clothes, jeans, women’s shoes, domestic appliances, and supplies.  She will do this because she wants to increase her stock in order to increase sales and get more customers.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothes, jeans, women’s shoes, domestic appliances, and supplies.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima sells food from a stall located in Msambweni. This is her first loan cycle with Yehu.

Halima will use this loan to buy supplies such as rice, vegetables, meat, sugar, etc. She will also buy utensils. The reason why she is requesting this loan is so that she can continue improving her business. Halima will utilize these benefits so that she can continue to buy supplies and improve her earnings. Her wish for her business is to convert it into a restaurant so she can provide better service to her customers.

Halima is a hardworking individual who is pleased to have the opportunity to acquire a loan.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as rice, vegetables, meat, sugar, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena lives with her husband and 5 children at Amonda, which is near Cape Coast. Abena sells rice and soap, which she has been doing for 3 years. She uses her income to support her husband and maintain the general upkeep of their home. Abena will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and boxes of soap to sell. With her profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and boxes of soap to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba  sells secondhand clothing at Nkramofokrom, near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for five years. She is married to a farmer and has four children. She uses her income to help her husband to pay their utility bills. 

Aba needs this loan to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, she will acquire a shop for the sale of her secondhand clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Lesly Yadira

texts.es:
La joven  Lesly  es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con  y sus 3 hijos, es soltera ella y sus hijos viven en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Lesly el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: maíz, frijoles, huevos, manteca, queso, pan, arroz, azúcar, refrescos, mantequilla, jabón, etc. Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más productos que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan a diario y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos, con esto mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Lesly en unos años espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más grande y conocido de la zona y que su familia siga adelante, y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades.	
Choluteca, Honduras –  octubre  2012
texts.en:
Lesly is a responsible, hardworking, and honest young woman.  She lives with her three children, and she is unmarried and lives in southern Honduras.  Her business is a grocery store.

Lesly needs a loan to buy corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice, sugar, drinks, butter, soap, etc.  With the loan, she hopes that her business' sales will increase, since she will have more products to offer to the customers who visit her each day and to provide their daily necessities.  With this, she will improve her family's home life.

Lesly hopes that in the next few years her business will grow and become the largest and most well-known in the area and that her family will get ahead.  She hopes that her children can finish their schooling and become good people with better opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras –  October,  2012

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, eggs, lard, cheese, bread, rice sugar, drinks, butter, soap, etc. for her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 60 years old and still practicing mixed crop farming. He has been in the farming business for the past eleven years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. He bought seedlings and fertilizer with the previous loan;  his farm did well and he made a profit out of it and bought one dairy cow. 

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. David will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, he will improve his family's living standard. His hopes and dreams are to export his farm produce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loans.name: Sofo

texts.en: Sofo   is married to a farmer and lives together with two children at Adum Banso near Takoradi.  Sofo sells eggs and fruit, which she has done for 5 years now. She uses her income to help her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Sofo will use her loan to buy crates of eggs and a variety of fruit to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: buy crates of eggs and a variety of fruit  to sell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua lives with her husband, who is a farmer, and 4 children in Nkromofokrom, which is near Cape Coast.  Ekua sells second-hand bed sheets and other items, which she has been doing for 2 years. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying for their children’s school fees. Ekua has a small amount of capital, so she needs a loan from Kiva to enable her to purchase more second-hand bed sheets and children's and ladies' clothing to sell. With her profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand bed sheets and children's and ladies' clothing to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba sells footwear at Nkramofokrom, near Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. Aba has been selling footwear for four years now. She helps her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  

Aba will use her loan to purchase more footwear to sell. She hope to use the new profits from her business to build a shop in which to sell her footwear.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear to sell

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 29 years old. He is married and has two children. He and his wife earn their income through the sale of crops and livestock. They grow maize, coffee, groundnuts and bananas. They also have pigs.  

Andrew looks forward to becoming a community knowledge worker (CKW). As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and to increase their incomes.  

With the additional income that Andrew earns as a CKW, he will purchase supplies to expand his farming business. He dreams of being able to purchase all the agriculture supplies that he needs.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua cooks banku for sale in Nkramofokrom, near Elmina. She serves it with okro soup, fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce. She is a married, with three children. Ekua has been in this business for eight years now. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of their family. 

Ekua's loan will be used to purchase bags of maize, fish and other ingredients that she uses in preparing her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a better stall in which to sell her cooked banku and soup.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for preparing food for her food stall

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Sandra, es separada y tiene un hijo y está en etapa escolar, viven en casa de sus padres, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Illimani Municipal  de la ciudad de El Alto.
Sandra estudió hasta el nivel secundario y actualmente se dedica a la elaboración de recuerdos para acontecimientos sociales, hace algunos meses ella también sub alquila mantelería (o sea que ella alquila mantelería de los lugares donde tienen y luego la sub-alquila a los dueños de las fiestas o acontecimientos sociales).
El crédito lo requiere para comprar tela, seda así ella podrá tener sus propios juegos de mesa, también adquirirá materia prima para elaborar los recuerdos.
El sueño de Sandra  es tener una microempresa de eventos sociales.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Sandra’s separated and has a school age son; they live in her parents’ house located in the city of El Alto’s Illimani Municipal zone.  Sandra attended secondary school and currently works making keepsakes for social events.  A few months ago she also started to lease table linen (that is, she rents it from places that have it and then she re-rents it to people hosting parties or social events).

She needs the loan to buy fabric and silk to make her own sets of table linen and she will also buy raw materials to make the keepsakes.  Sandra’s dream is to have a social event mini firm.  This is the first time she’s asked for credit from IMPRO and from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy fabric and party supplies

loans.name: Lesly Yalila

texts.es:
La joven Lesly es una persona honesta, trabajadora y responsable, vive con sus padres y sus 2 hijos, es madre soltera y vive en el sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una venta de golosinas y de ropa usada.
Lesly el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: ropa usada como pantalones, camisas, Shorts, calzonetas, carnes, maíz, condimentos etc. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten al tener más producto y mercadería para cubrir los pedidos de los clientes que visitan a diario su negocio ya que es una zona muy productiva agroindustrial, con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar ella espera que su familia pueda estar mejor.
En el futuro Lesly espera contar con un mejor espacio físico para poder vender en una glorieta ya que en los momentos no cuenta con un local y así poder seguir apoyando a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos, también desea que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades en el futuro.
Choluteca, Honduras – octubre 2012
texts.en:
Lesly is an honest, hardworking, and responsible young woman. She lives with her parents and her two children, and she is a single mother and lives in southern Honduras. Her business is a snack shop and used clothing store.

Lesly is in need of a loan to buy used clothing; like pants, shirts, shorts, tights; meats, corn, condiments, etc.  With this loan, she hopes to grow her sales by having more products and merchandise to fill the needs of the customers who visit her each day, since this is a very productive agricultural and industrial zone.  With this increase in income for the household, she hopes that her family will live better.

In the future, Lesly hope to find a better physical space for the business to be able to sell products near a traffic roundabout since at this moment, her business does not have a fixed location, and this way she would be able to continue helping out her family, now that they are in dire straits.  She also hopes that her children will finish their schooling and become good people with better opportunities for their future.

Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2012

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, shorts, tights, meats, corn, condiments, etc. for her businesses.

loans.name: Gervin Alonso

texts.es:
Don Gervín es una persona muy emprendedora, honesto y trabajador junto con el viven su esposa en el  al Sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la venta de  recargas telefónicas.
Don Gervin el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: recargas. Con el préstamo el espera que sus ventas en su negocio  aumenten al tener más saldo de recargas que ofrecer a los clientes que lo visitan a diario o lo llaman para solicitarle este servicio y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos, así mismo seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de su familia.
Don Gervin en el  futuro él desea que su negocio crezca hasta convertirse en un cibernet grande de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a su familia ya que son  personas  de  escasos  recursos  económicos.
Choluteca, Honduras –  octubre  2012
texts.en:
Gervín is a very entrepreneurial, honest, and hardworking person who lives with his wife in the South of Honduras.  His business is selling cell phone minutes.

Gervin needs a loan in order to buy phone cards to add minutes to cell phones.  With this loans, he hopes that his business' sales will increase by having more phone card options for the customers who visit each day or call him to ask for his services and to fulfill all their needs.  At the same time, he wants to continue improving his family's quality of life.

Gervin wants his business to grow and become a large internet cafe in the future and continue to support his family, who are currently quite poor.

Choluteca, Honduras –  October, 2012

loans.use: to buy phone cards for his business.

loans.name: Celia  Patricia

texts.es: Celia de 47 años es comerciante; ella vende calzado, ropa y accesorios en el municipio de Barranquilla, donde vive con su esposo e hijo de 18 años; Estudiando en el SENA (Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje), un establecimiento público que invierte en el desarrollo social y técnico de los trabajadores colombianos, creó su idea de negocio, en el que ya lleva hoy, 13 años de trabajo, vendiendo calzado y ropa para damas,  a personas del sector donde vive, cerca del estadio Metropolitano  de Barranquilla, escenario de futbol del balompié Colombiano. Celia está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará   calzado, blusas, y jeans, los cuales son sus productos más populares, con los que planea  aumentar su surtido y por lo tanto las ventas. Algún día, a ella le gustaría abrir su propio local comercial, o de pronto estudiar técnicas de cocina en el SENA, porque cocinar es otra de sus máximas pasiones.
texts.en:
Celia is 47 and she is a merchant. She sells shoes, clothing, and accessories in the town of Barranquilla, where she lives with her husband and their eighteen-year-old son. 

She attended SENA (National Learning Services), a public organization which invests in social and technical development for Colombian workers, and started her business venture, which she has been working on for thirteen years now. She sells women's shoes and clothing to people in her neighborhood, near the Metropolitan Stadium in Barranquilla, a Colombian soccer field. 

Celia has applied for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing she requests from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase shoes, blouses, and jeans, which are her most popular items. This will allow her to increase her stock and also her sales. 

Some day she would like to open her own retail store, or perhaps go to cooking school at SENA, because cooking is another of her main passions.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, blouses, and jeans.

loans.name: Janeth Mercedes

texts.es:
La joven Janeth es una persona emprendedora y responsable, junto con el viven su esposo y su hija en el Sur de Honduras. Sus ingresos son los que percibe por su negocio que es la venta de repuestos para impresoras.
Janeth el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de tóner, impresoras, tinta, Mouse`s y memorias usb. Con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas para ofrecer una mejor gama de mercadería a sus clientes, así mismo seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de la familia.
En el futuro Janeth desea poder comprar una propiedad de esta manera poder tener su propio local. Y seguir apoyando a su esposo y a su familia ya que son de escasos recursos económicos.
Choluteca, Honduras – Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Janeth is an entrepreneurial and responsible young woman who lives with her husband and daughter in the southern region of Honduras.  Her income is what she gets from her business, which is sales of parts and accessories for printers.

Janeth needs this loan to buy toner, printers, ink, computer mice, and USB drives.  With this loan, she hopes to increase her sales and offer a greater range of products to her customers and continue improving her family's life.

In the future, Janeth wants to be able to buy her own property and have her own business location there.  She also wants to continue supporting her husband and family who don't have many other resources.

Choluteca, Honduras – October, 2012

loans.use: to buy toner, printers, ink, computer mice, and USB drives for her business.

loans.name: Leonicia

texts.es:
La señora Leonicia  de 56 años de edad, es madre  soltera tiene 1 hija que dependen de ella, tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de tortillas y frescos, en su casa tiene una pequeña pulpería, su venta es con los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan, radica en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, Doña Leonicia  es una mujer trabajadora y con muchos deseos de salir adelante y es muy honrada  en sus compromisos.
Doña Leonicia esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de maíz, leña, frescos, churros y galletas. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio ya que desea comprar la materia prima para seguir elaborando las tortillas y  surtir su pequeña pulpería de esta manera salir adelante con su familia. Ella esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma en sus préstamos y su sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Leonicia, 56, is a single mother of one dependent daughter.  She owns a house and for the last ten years has been in the business of selling tortillas and fruit drinks.  She has a small grocery store at home and she sells to neighbors who visit her store daily.  She lives in the community of San Lorenzo in south Honduras.  Leonicia is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and is very honest with her commitments.

Leonicia is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood, fruit drinks, snacks and cookies.  With support from this loan she intends to cover her business’ financial need because she wants to buy raw materials to continue making tortillas and to stock her small grocery store to get ahead with her family this way.  She’s very happy to continue working with Prisma loans and her dream is to make some home improvements.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, snacks, cookies,etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cedar and paint.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama   is a petty trader. She sells panties, ladies' wear, children's dresses and underwear at  Nkramfokrom  near Cape Coast. She has been in this business for the past 10 years now.  

Ama  is married. She uses her income to help her husband  to pay their utility and accommodation bills.  She  need this loan to enable her to purchase more underwear and ladies' and children's dresses  to sell. With the new profit, she plans to acquire a shop for the sale of her dresses.

loans.use: to purchase more underwear and  ladies' and children's dresses  to sell

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina sells maize at Amoanda  near Cape Coast. She is a widow  and has four children.    As a single parent,  she uses her income  to feed and  clothe her children and pay their school fees.   Justina needs this loan to purchase bags of maize for sale. With the new profit,  Justina  wishes to acquire a large quantity of maize to distribute to retailers.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for sale.

loans.name: Maboudou

texts.fr:
Mr MABOUDOU est célibataire sans enfant et n’a personne à sa charge.
Il est étudiant en classe de Master II professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis 04ans.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il compte après ses études travailler dans une grande entreprise de la place pendant au moins trois ans avant de se marié. Avec le temps, il compte créer son propre entreprise dans le domaine de Génie Civil.
texts.en:
Mr MABOUDOU is single. He has no children and no dependents.

He has been studying at ESTPO (Graduate School of Public Works of Ouagadougou) for almost four years. He is currently in the final class before obtaining a Master’s degree in technology.

Mr. MABOUDOU wants to finance his graduate studies. When he has completed them, he intends on working in a reputable local company for at least three years before getting married. In time, he plans to create his own business in the Public Works sector.

loans.use: finance his graduate studies.

loans.name: 15 De Junio (Flat) Group

texts.es:
La señora Teresa tiene la edad de 59 años, solo estudio la primaria,  y esta soltera pues sus hijos ya se encuentran casadas. Ella desde muy pequeña inicio a trabajar y a base de sus esfuerzo saco adelante a sus hijos pero actualmente ella realiza venta de antojitos mexicanos los fines de semana (Viernes, Sábados y Domingos) en un pequeño corredor que construyo enfrente de su casa también entre semana saca sus ventas de variedad de dulces y chicharrones.
Como ya tiene 4 años con sus ventas la gente del pueblo ya la conoce y además comentan que tiene un muy rico sazón lo cual le ayuda a atraer mas clientes.
Con este préstamo Doña Teresa comprara chiles, tomates, cebollas, carne, papas, huevos, tortillas, maíz, queso, crema, lechuga, frijoles, aceite, refrescos y variedad de dulces.
Ella espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y así poner tener una mejor vida.

Ella es integrante de 15 de Junio el cual esta integrado por 11 personas y se ubica en la comunidad de Tetela la cual se caracteriza por estar en una región cañera y su gente se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de caña de azúcar. Los demás integrantes del grupo son: Maria Maribel taller de costura, Maria del Rosario joyería y cerámica, Maria manualidades, Cirilo venta de ropa, Fermin repostería, Maria Josefina venta pan, Clara Luz venta de comida, Micaela venta de lencería, Maria Santos venta de ropa, Denisse venta de bisutería.

Nota: La señora de Blusa Amarilla es mama de Maria del Rosario y se a tomado la foto con el grupo en representación de su hija
texts.en:
Teresa is 59 years old. She only completed primary school and she lives alone, since her children are already married. She started working as a very young child, and through much effort she managed to raise her children. Currently she sells traditional corn-based Mexican dishes on the weekends (Friday, Saturday, and Sunday) at a small corridor that she built in front of her home. During the week she also brings out a variety of sweets and pork rinds to sell. 

She has been doing this for four years, so the people in town already know her and they also mention she is a very gifted cook, which helps her attract more customers.

Teresa will use this loan to purchase chiles, tomatoes, onions, meat, potatoes, eggs, tortillas, corn, cheese, cream, lettuce, beans, oil, soft drinks, and assorted sweets. She expects her business to prosper from this investment so that she can have a better life.

She belongs to 15 de Junio, which comprises eleven members and is located in the community of Tetela, which is known for being in a sugarcane-producing region. Its people work planting and growing sugarcane. The other members of the group are: Maria Maribel, who has a sewing shop; Maria del Rosario, who sells jewelry and ceramics; Maria, who makes crafts; Cirilo, who sells clothing; Fermin, who is a baker; Maria Josefina, who sells bread; Clara Luz, who sells food; Micaela, who sells lingerie; Maria Santos, who sells clothing; and Denisse, who sells costume jewelry.

Note: The lady in the yellow top is Maria del Rosario's mother and had her picture taken on her daughter's behalf.
