Elías, se dedica a la venta de frutas, vive con sus padres y hermanos, quienes le dan un aporte económico para su familia, todos trabajan en la familia, el negocio de Elías está situado a la par de una escuela, vende sola y ya tiene aproximadamente un año en el negocio.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de frutas mangos, jocotes, coco, entre otras frutas, esto le ayudara para tener surtido el negocio, atraerá más clientes por sus frutas frescas, satisfaciendo mejor sus preferencias.
Sus sueños son tener mayores ingresos económicos para apoyar a sus padres, ya que tienen avanzada edad.
texts.en:
Elías works selling fruit; he lives with his parents and siblings who contribute towards family economy.  Everyone in the family works.  Elías’ work is located next to a school.  He sells alone and has been in business about a year.

He requests a loan to buy fruit like mangoes, nance and coconut, among others.  This will help him have the business stocked.  His fresh fruit will attract more customers meeting their needs better.  His dream is to earn higher income to support his parents since they are elderly.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Jonathan Alexander

texts.es:
Jonathan, vive con su esposa, en casa familiar, no tienen hijos, él se dedica a la venta de mariscos, compra los productos en el malecón, y los vende en otro departamento donde es poca la presencia de mariscos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de un frisser para mantener los mariscos frescos,esta inversion le permitira mantener su calidad en el producto y atender la demanda de los clientes.
La aspiración de Jonathan es comprarse un vehículo, en el cual pueda transportarse a distintas zonas, para ofrecer los mariscos.
texts.en: Jonathan lives with his wife in the family home; they have no children.  He sells seafood that he buys at the pier to resell in a different department where seafood is scarce.  He requests the loan to buy a freezer to keep the seafood fresh.  This investment will make it possible for him to preserve the quality of his product and to meet customer demand.  Jonathan’s hope is to buy a vehicle to get to distant zones to sell his seafood.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Florentin

texts.es:
Florentín, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita capital de trabajo, para iniciar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, se comprara con los fondos prestados abono y herbicidas, este crédito ayudara a que él tenga los insumos necesarios para el cultivo.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a la compra de abono para cultivar maíz, con las ganancias de la cosecha ha podido ayudar a su familia, todas las condiciones en su familia se mantienen.
texts.en: Florentín is requesting a new loan because he needs working capital to start a new corn and bean crop.  He will use the lent money to buy manure and herbicide.  This loan will help him have the necessary farm supplies for his crops.  His previous loan helped him buy manure to grow corn.  With profits from the harvest he’s been able to help his family.  All of his family conditions are stable.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Orangel Hipolito

texts.es:
Orangel,  Vive con su esposa y cinco hijos, la ocupación de Orangel es la siembra de maíz y frijoles, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace 35 años, trabaja todos los días de la semana desde las 6:00am hasta las 3:00pm, hasta la fecha no ha presentado ningún inconveniente.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y herbicidas, los cuales aplicara al cultivo para fortalecer la siembra, este crédito le ayudara a comprar los insumos para realizar el cultivo de maíz y frijol, con la cosecha ayudara a su familia con los gastos.
Su objetivo es ayudar a su familia a mejorar la condición económica.
texts.en:
Orangel lives with his wife and five children.  He works growing corn and beans, an activity he’s been in for 35 years.  He works every day of the week from 6am until 3pm.  To date, he’s had no obstacles.

He’s requesting a loan to buy manure and herbicide to apply to the crop to strengthen it.  This loan will help him buy supplies needed for the corn and bean crops.  He’ll be able to help cover family expenses with the harvest.   His goal is to help his family to improve its economic condition.

loans.use: to buy manure and herbicide.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Maria has been in this business for three years. Maria earns more income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Nori Belen

texts.en:
Nori belen is 56 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Nori belen is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Nori belen has been farming rice for nine years and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Remila

texts.en:
Remila is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling spices in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spices for resale, like onion, garlic, ginger, etc., for her business.

Remila has been in this business for 15 years. Remila earns more income from buying and selling peanuts. Remila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional spices for resale, like onion, garlic, ginger, etc.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
María, es una humilde costurera de 53  años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de tres hijos mayores de edad.  
Inicio desde muy joven como ayudante de costura, luego le daban trabajo de medio tiempo  pero ella decidió buscar otras alternativas para emprender su propio negocio  busco financiamiento por medio de préstamos grupales pero noto que era mejor trabajar individual, se especializo en ropa de bebes que es lo que actualmente ella elabora. 
Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar tela, hilos, encajes, cintas de colores. Su expectativa es aumentar su línea de productos y darse a conocer fuera de la ciudad de Granada, pues lo bordados que elabora son únicos y preciosos.
texts.en:
María is a humble, 53 year old seamstress from Granada.  She has three grown children.

She started as a seamstress helper when she was very young.  Then they gave her part time work.  However, she decided to look for other alternatives.  In order to undertake her own business, she looked for financing through group loans.  Nevertheless, she noted that it was better to work individually.  She specializes in clothing for babies, which is what she is currently making.

She needs the loan to buy fabric, thread, lace, and colored ribbons.  Her expectation is to increase her line of products and to become known outside the city of Granada.  The embroidery that she does is unique and beautiful.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, lace, and colored ribbons.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is 56 years old, married and has eight children. 

Clarita is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Clarita requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Clarita has been pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

In the future, Clarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school. Connie works very hard to provide for them.

Connie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store.

Connie has been in this business for seven years. 

In the future, Connie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ellia

texts.en:
Ellia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Ellia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc.

Ellia has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Ellia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, soft drinks, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Nancy works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling vegetables.  Nancy is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, spices, egg, noodles, etc. for her general store.

Nancy has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like shampoo, spices, egg, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Los Huertos Group

texts.es:
Los huertos es el nombre de un grupo integrado por 6 personas ellos han decidido poner este nombre a su grupo porque es el nombre de la colonia donde viven y hacen sus reuniones, este grupo se ubica en la comunidad de Vicente en la cual se encuentra el ingenio Las Margaritas el cual brinda empleos a los habitantes de esta comunidad y comunidades cercanas.

Don Eduardo es uno de los miembros de este grupo, tiene la edad de 42 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casado,el nos platica que trabaja como obrero en el ingenio desde que era joven, pero hace un poco mas de 1 año decidió abrir su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes en su casa el cual atiende su esposa con la intención de ganar un poco mas de dinero extra y brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, el dice que se vende muy bien los abarrotes ya que la colonia es nueva y solo hay dos tiendas por esto el siempre busca que su tienda este surtida con variedad de productos para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo que busquen y ganar la preferencia de sus clientes. Con este crédito el comprara variedad de frijol, arroz, atún, sopa, aceite, variedad de galletas, jabón, cloro, refrescos, productos en latados, papel de baño, pasta dental y dulces para resurtir su negocio. a futuro le gustaría poder construir un local en el cual ubicar bien su negocio.

los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Trinidad venta de ropa 
Norma venta de perfumes 
Martha venta de ropa 
Yanet venta de lencería 
Nancy venta de calzado
texts.en:
The Los Huertos group has six members. They chose their name because it is the name of the neighborhood where they live and hold their meetings. The group is located in the village of Vicente, where the Las Margaritas sugar refinery provides employment to the inhabitants of Vicente and nearby communities.
Eduardo is one of the members of the group. He is 42 years old and married, and he only completed high school. He tells us that he's worked at the sugar refinery since he was young, but a little over a year ago he decided to open his own business selling groceries in his house to earn a little more money and be able to give his family a higher quality of life. His wife tends the shop, and he tells us it's quite successful because the neighborhood is a new one and only has two stores. He keeps his store well stocked with a variety of products so his customers will always find what they're looking for and become loyal to his store. He will use this loan to buy beans, rice, tuna, soup, oil, cookies and crackers, soap, bleach, soft drinks, canned goods, toilet paper, toothpaste, and sweets to restock his business. In the future he would like to be able to build a separate building for his shop.
The other members of the group are:
Trinidad - clothing sales
Norma - perfume sales
Martha - clothing sales
Yanet - lingerie sales
Nancy - shoe sales

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, tuna, soup, oil, cookies and crackers, soap, bleach, soft drinks, canned goods, toilet paper, toothpaste, and sweets.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

Lydia requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory of ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

Lydia has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Lydia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of ready-to-wear clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is 38 years old and has two children. She has a common-law husband.

Mildred is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Mildred requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mildred has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mildred would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Dellilah

texts.en:
Dellilah is 65 years old and a widowed mother of six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dellilah has a firewood sales business in the Philippines. Dellilah requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Dellilah has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Dellilah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Edeltrudes

texts.en:
Edeltrudes is 43 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Edeltrudes has a dry goods business in the Philippines. Edeltrudes requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase hair accessories, clips and combs to sell to her customers.

Edeltrudes has been in this business for one year. In the future, Edeltrudes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair accessories, clips and combs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Jumana

texts.en: Jumana is now in her second year at the university, majoring in biological engineering. Wanting to graduate and get a bachelor's degree, Jumana has applied for another educational loan so she can pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for the upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Wedad

texts.en: Wedad is a 19-year-old single woman who has two brothers and is studying education and how to become a teacher in the future. She has applied for this loan to support her education and to pay for her semester and registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester and registration fees.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy is a university student in her freshman year. She registered to study and be specialized in Arabic Languages in a governmental university located in the north of Jordan. Wanting to get a bachelor degree has led Nancy to apply for this loan to support her in paying the registration and semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for registration and semester fees

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man, and he has a younger brother and sister. He says being the oldest child makes him feel more responsible for his actions and for his siblings. To be a good role model, he works in a clothing store when he is not attending university. 

Now that he is in his third year of college, studying Managerial Information Systems, Mohammad wants to graduate as soon as possible so he can find a full time job in a Jordanian company. He applied for this loan to support himself and pay for his next semester of school fees.

loans.use: pay for his upcoming school fees.

loans.name: Donia

texts.en: Donia is a microfinance member of PMPC. She is 42 years old, and married with two adult children and one school-aged child. For a period of three years, her major source of income has come from making and selling snacks, and she makes an average monthly income of 1,500 PHP. She has taken another loan from PMPC, in the amount of 6,000 PHP, to purchase ingredients to make snacks. She plans to use the profit to support the daily needs of her family and to save for the education of her child.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia de 30 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus tres hijos en su casa ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 4 años al negocio de ropa nueva y usada, perfumes, fajas y mucho mas, su venta es con los vecinos, amigos y personas que le encargan sus productos. Sus ventas son de manera ambulante.
Doña Sonia con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para realizar  su proyecto que es lo de  terminar de construir un baño para su casa he instalar una cisterna plástica para el uso de la familia con el dinero ella comprara cemento, varilla, ladrillos, pago de mano de obra y compra de un rotoplas.
Doña Sonia esta muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma en sus préstamos.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre  del 2012.
texts.en:
Sonia, 30, lives with her spouse and three children in a house located in the community of San Lorenzo in south Honduras.  She’s been selling new and used clothes, perfume, blankets and others for four years.  She sells to neighbors, friends and people who order products from her.  Her sales are from place to place.

With support from this loan, Sonia plans to cover the financial need her project of finishing building her bathroom and installing a plastic water tank for family use has.  She will use the money to buy cement, rebar, and bricks and to pay labor costs.  She will also buy a Rotoplas [brand of plastic water storage tanks].

Sonia is very happy to continue working with Prisma loans.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Don Wilfredo es una persona muy responsable, honesto y trabajador junto con el viven su esposa y sus 5  hijos   en el  al Sur de Honduras. Sus ingresos  son los  que  percibe   como  trabajo permanente  en  una  camaronera  de  la  zona. Don Wilfredo el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de: cemento, lámina, arena y ladrillos. Para  su hacer un Servicio sanitario  baño y pila. Con el préstamo el espera tener mas comodidad y seguir mejorando la calidad de vida de la familia. En el  futuro él desea poder  mejorar  su vivienda de  esta manera  poder seguir apoyando a su familia a  una vida mejor y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios  y tenga mejores  oportunidades.
Choluteca, Honduras –  Octubre  2012
texts.en:
Wilfredo’s a very responsible, honest, hardworking man.  His wife and five children live with him in south Honduras.  His income is what he earns working for a local shrimp processing plant.  Wilfredo needs the loan to buy cement, metal sheeting, sand and bricks to build a bathroom and install a water storage tank.  With the loan he hopes to have more comfort and continue improving his family’s quality of life.  In the future he’d like to be able to do home improvements to continue supporting his family and giving a better life and that his children complete their schooling and have better opportunities.


Choluteca, Honduras - October, 2012

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ragheb

texts.en: Ragheb, a 21-year-old ambitious single man, is the oldest brother of five siblings. Ragheb works as an electrician, and at the same time, goes to the university to study Media and Communications Technology. Ragheb depends on his salary to pay for his education, but due to the holiday season, he faced a little financial issue that led him to apply for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en: Bassem believes that studying English Language and Literature will help him in improving his career life, whether he stays at his current job, or works in the education field. Bassem has applied for another loan so he can pay for his upcoming semester fees as he has faced some financing shortage.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer, a 52-year-old conservative woman, has asked one of her sons, “Hamzah”, to take her place in the photo. Hamzah is a 19-year-old university student majoring in computer sciences. Now Ghadeer wants to support Hamzah in his education as she did with his two older brothers before; so she applied for this loan so she can pay for his semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her son's semester fees.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a second year university student majoring in Business Administration. She is the oldest sister of seven siblings. Being in a big family, she wanted to decrease the financial pressure on her parents, so she has applied for this loan in order to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 19-year-old woman who lives with her parents. She chose to enroll in a vocational training center and learn about tailoring and embroidery. Recently, Samar started using what she has learned to create embroidered wall hangings and pillow covers. 

Samar wants to start a small business selling her embroidery in the market and to participate in crafts exhibitions. She has applied for this youth loan to buy fabric, thread, and other necessary materials to help her achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy more fabric, thread, and other embroidery materials.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en: Nawal is a 28-year-old housewife and mother of a two-year-old daughter and a one-year-old son; her husband works as a blacksmith. Nawal started a small clothing sales business at home a few months ago. Now that she has a good number of customers and the holiday season is approaching, she wants to seize the opportunity to increase her sales. She has applied for a youth loan to purchase more clothing and expand her winter collection.

loans.use: to purchase more winter clothing for sale.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
Jacinta is 45 years old, and is still practicing mixed-crop farming. She has been in the farming business for the past 19 years, and with a monthly income of 20,000 KES, she supports her family. Instead of buying seedlings and fertilizer, as stated in the previous loan description, she bought one expectant pig. With the profit made from the sale of milk, she bought fertilizer and seedlings. Her farm products did well and she made a profit off of them. 


Jacinta is applying for her second loan from KADET after successfully repaying the previous loan. She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 


With the anticipated profit from her business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to export her farm products.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a required course for graduation as well as monthly tuition payments.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a proactive 24-year-old man who works in an engineering consulting office, while continuing to study to get his bachelor's degree in engineering. After that, he wants to look for a job in the gulf area, where he believes it will add a lot of experience for him. Now he has applied for this loan to pay for his semester tuition.

loans.use: to pay for his semester tuition.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a 21-year-old married woman and mother of two children. In her free time, Amal makes baskets, trays, and frames using straw and hay, including the fruit baskets shown in the photo. 

Amal has applied for this youth loan to purchase more materials, which will allow her to increase her productivity and make more pieces.

loans.use: to purchase crafting materials.

loans.name: Asefa

texts.en: Asefa is the 42-year-old mother of six sons and daughters. She wants to help improve their living conditions and to provide her kids with the best life she can afford. With this in mind, Asefa started a small clothing sales business a while ago.  She brings the goods from wholesale and free zone markets, and then sells them at her house to neighbors, relatives and friends. Now Asefa is applying for this loan, to get a new winter collection in preparation for the upcoming season.

loans.use: to get a new winter collection to resell in her home business.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en: Elna, 45 years old, is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with a 15-year-old daughter whom she supports. Elna is engaged in buying and selling bananas in her community to earn an income. She is asking for a loan to buy bananas from farmers and sell the crops to the market for a profit. Elna dreams of improving her business profitability so she can provide for her family. In the future, she hopes to send her child to college to give her a better life.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa is 57 years old and has three adult children. She is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. Rosa and her husband are engaged in producing coconuts as well as farming rice. She is asking for a loan to buy tungog (coconut wine coloring ingredient) and 5-gallon containers that she can use for her coconut wines. This will make her task of collecting coconut wine easier and will help her be more productive. Her profit will allow her to buy a healthy diet for her family. In the future, she hopes to have a bigger income so she can continue to expand her farming business too.

loans.use: to buy coconut wine coloring ingredients and 5-gallon containers

loans.name: Clara Isabel

texts.es:
La Sra. Clara tiene la edad de 43 años es soltera con un hijo ella ya tiene 3 años dedicándose
a la venta de toners y productos para impresora, ella y su hijo han desarrollado un negocio
Rentable, la Sra. clara tiene como propósito seguir extendiéndose para lograr una mejor ganancia en su negocio y así poder tener mas sucursales, en esta ocasión la Sra. Clara necesita su préstamo para poder comprar mas mercancía y así obtener un poco mas de ganancias estaría muy agradecida de contar con este apoyo.
texts.en:
Clara is 43 years old, single, and has one son. For the past three years she has made a living selling toner and printer products. She and her son have established a profitable business. Clara would like to continue expanding in order to make a better profit from her business and be able to open more locations. 

Clara needs her loan to buy more merchandise in order to make a better profit. She would be very thankful to have the support.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Ghada

texts.en:
Ghada is a 37-year-old married woman. She is a conservative religious person, so she asked her husband Nael to appear in the photo in her place.

Ghada and Nael live in a rented home. Nael drives a taxi, and Ghada stays home making antique-style bird cages from wood. At first, she made cages to order, but now she sells her product to bird shops. Nael helps her with her business when he is off work, bringing her wood and other necessary materials. 

Ghada has applied for this loan to purchase more materials and start making more wooden crafts other than cages.

loans.use: to purchase more crafting materials.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina is 54 years old and comes from the community of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and has four children, ages 19 - 30. She supports the needs of her family by farming rice and by making and selling coconut wine. (Her husband collects the coconuts from coconut trees.) She has engaged in this business for 20 years. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for her rice crop, and tungog (a palm vinegar coloring ingredient). She hopes that this will make her farm more productive so she can have a better income for her family. She hopes that she can save enough to renovate her house and buy home furnishings in the future.

loans.use: to buy a coloring ingredient for making coconut wine, and fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca manages a rice farm and a sari-sari store in the town of San Miguel, Bohol. She is married with four children. Three of her children are adults and the youngest is 18.

Rebecca's goal is to make her farming business more profitable. She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm. An increase in her income will mean nutritious food for her family, savings and a thriving business. Any additional profit will be used for house renovation and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three children who are 8, 9 and 11 years old. She is currently engaged in selling dry goods like kitchen utensils, lunch boxes, flashlights, raincoats, canisters, etc.
 
Marilyn works hard in order to help support the needs of her family. Her husband works as an engineer and she hopes to be a better spouse through this business. However, she lacks the funds or the capital for the improvement of her business. At this time, Marilyn is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy photo frames, flashlights and glasses. 

Marilyn believes that if she is provided with financial support through loan, she can finally be able to purchase the necessary stock for her business. In the future, she believes that through this opportunity she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her a larger amount of income. She hopes that she can continually send her children to school so that they will be able to gain a higher level of learning for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy photo frames, flashlights and glasses

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel lives in the community of San Miguel, Bohol along with her husband and two children who are 11 and 13 years old. To provide for her family, she started a dry goods business five years ago. She sells items like flashlights, nail cutters, mirrors, batteries and kitchen utensils. Maricel is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy more supplies for her store like belts, caps, batteries and mirrors.
 
With the loan, Maricel will be able to increase her inventory level, attracting more customers. This will increase her sales and income. With the profits, she will be able to provide her family with the things they need and her children will be able to go to school.

loans.use: to buy belts, caps, batteries and mirrors

loans.name: Lou Ignacius

texts.en:
Like most people in San Miguel, Bohol, Lou Ignacius earns an income farming rice. He is married but has no children yet. He has been farming rice for two years now, and this provides for his and his family's needs. 

Lou Ignacius is asking for a loan to buy a sprayer, pesticides, insecticides, and fertilizer for his farm. The loan will allow him to save money and further expand his farm. In the future, he hopes to expand into other types of business.

loans.use: to buy a sprayer, pesticides, insecticides, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.en:
Catalino is from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. He is 50 years old and operates a sari-sari (convenience) store in his community, which he has done for two years. He sells household basic commodities like detergent, seasoning, toiletries, chips, canned goods and soft drinks. In addition to this, he owns a vulcanizing business. 

He is asking for a loan to buy more items to resell, like coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles and rice. These items are in high demand and sell well on a daily basis. With a loan, Catalino is confident that his sari-sari business will be more prosperous. He will use his profits for the school fees of his four children who are 7, 9, 12, and 14 years old.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, toiletries, canned goods, noodles and rice

loans.name: Jonas

texts.en:
Jonas is a 30-year-old businessman from the town of San Miguel, Bohol. For three years, he has made a good living buying and selling flip flops, slippers, and clothing. He is asking for a loan to buy more slippers to increase his income. He hopes that the loan will help him provide a healthy diet and education for his three children, aged five months and five and eight years. 

In the future, Jonas dreams of expanding his business to sell a wider variety of products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy slippers and flip flops for sale.

loans.name: Glyn

texts.en:
Glyn, 38 years old, is from San Miguel, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. She has three children ages 7, 9 and 15. Glyn helps her family by being a banana supplier in the market. She buys bananas from farmers and delivers it to the market to sell. Her business started 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy more bananas that she can resell for a profit. Her income will provide food and education to her precious children

In the future, she hopes to have another business that will generate an income for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy bananas

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en: Shakila is 29 years old, married and raising five children. She is a very hardworking person and has two years of experience in this business. She is involved in selling fruits and vegetables. Lately, she has had only a small number of clients because of high competition and inability to support her clients. Shakila needs to urgently expand her product selection in order to bring back her clients. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame, 25, lives in the town of Msambweni, Kenya with her spouse and two children. Three months ago, she started her own fast-food business aiming at earning an income to support the family. The business is located in a strategic place in the market. She sells boiled rice served with beans or meat, ugali, soft drinks, snacks, candy, and other items.

She’s asking for her first loan for 10,000 KES to buy ingredients like meats, condiments, flour, salt and other items to make fast food. This loan will help her capitalize and get the business going. Her goal is to increase sales and income to be able to help pay for her children’s schooling and to improve their quality of life

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meats, condiments, flour, salt, etc to make food to sell

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma, 35, lives with her three children and husband in her own house. She makes a living selling clothing: shirts, blouses, pants, and dresses, among other things. She has worked for one year in this business and has acquired a lot of experience in sales, which allows her to make a good profit. She sells at the market. 

Mwanajuma is an enterprising woman who is dedicated to her job and very much wants to get ahead. She's always waiting for new opportunities that will open the door to success because she knows that's the only that way will she achieve what she wants.

Demand for her products has increased recently, and Mwanajuma wants to make the most of it with a new investment. She's asking Yehu for a loan to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a 69-year-old hardworking woman with a great desire to get ahead. She is a widow who lives alone since all her children passed away. Despite all these adversities and her old age, Asha is determined to seek opportunities to sustain her. For the last two years, she has been selling fish at the market earning only her daily bread.

However, it has shown some good results.  As a result, she wishes to increase her business further by selling more fish. Asha is asking for a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fish, cooking oil, and a frying pan for her developing business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more fish, cooking oil, and a frying pan

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is 26 years old and comes from Msambweni, Kenya. He owns an internet cafe in an area of Msambweni where there is no other internet cafe.

Swalehe has asked Yehu for this loan to buy a desktop computer. He hopes this loan will help him improve his income and, thus, his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a desktop computer.

loans.name: Mwanamvua

texts.en:
Mwanamvua is a 24-year-old woman. She has two children. She lives with her family in the town of Msambweni in the coastal region of Kenya. She has been running a business selling clothes for three years. She sells her merchandise door-to-door.

Mwanamvua would like to take a loan to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers.

She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income, which would help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
In life, one always encounters success and failure, but what never is lacking is a desire to improve one's situation. This is what is most important for Biasha, who lives with her family in her own house. She sells clothing -- shirts, pants, and dresses, among other items. She sells in a location which she considers is very good for business, and she already has many customers who prefer the quality of her products, low prices and, above all, excellent service she provides.

Biasha is a very active, enterprising woman, who is dedicated to her work, and who has many goals to achieve. She is working hard to have a more prosperous future and is happy with the business, but she knows she must expand it in order to overcome poverty.
 
Lately, she has noticed an increase in demand and therefore wants to make a larger investment to buy merchandise. Thus, she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale clothing. She is very satisfied with this support, because she knows she has a good credit record and is very responsible. While committed to paying back the loan on time, she is also confident she will be able to provide her household with economic security.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing to resell in her business location.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, 23 years old, is married and has three children. Her husband works as a conductor in a public transportation vehicle. She supports her family through the income she earns from making and selling different types of African dishes. She began this business two years ago. 

Mwanamisi intends to take a loan to buy ingredients, such as corn flour, food flavors, rice, meat and vegetables. The additional capital will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business will run smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as corn flour, food flavors, rice, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: La Sra. norma Hernández tiene la edad de 37 años es casada tiene tres hijos ella se dedica al comercio, vende productos por catalogo así como también los fines de semana vende ropa, dinero con el cual ayuda a s esposo con los gastos de la vivienda su esposo por su parte tiene un sueldo mas seguro ya que trabaja para una compañía como albañil y también realiza algunos trabajos por fuera del albañilería y ese dinero extra lo tratan de ahorrar porque desean seguir mejorando, la Sra. norma esta solicitando un crédito para poder bardear su nueva vivienda en que les hace falta de frente como en la parte posterior, una de las principales causas porque están solicitando este crédito es porque anteriormente intentaron robarles por lo cual a laborar dicha barda tendrán mayor seguridad así como también mejoraran el patrimonio que desean heredarle a sus hijos.
texts.en: Norma Hernández is 37 years old. She is married and has three children. She is a merchant and sells products via catalog. On weekends she also sells clothing. The money helps her husband with living expenses. On his part, her husband has a more stable salary. He works in a company as a bricklayer and also does some side jobs as a bricklayer. They try to save that extra money because they want to keep improving. Norma is asking for a loan to be able to wall in her new home. They need it in front and in back. One of the main reasons they are asking for this loan is because previously there have been attempts to rob them. With the fence they will have more security and they will also improve the property they want to leave their children as inheritance.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 30 years old and lives with her life companion, Mwadime, and her two children in her own house. She owns a store where she sells basic needs products including basic grains, eggs, bread, milk, soap and other items. 

She has had this business for two years and has a lot of sales experience that allows her to obtain greater earnings. The store is located in her home in an area in which people pass by frequently. She already has many regular customers. 

Sofia is known for her happiness and friendliness. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work, is entrepreneurial and has many goals for the future. Every day she works hard to have a more prosperous future. She does not surrender until she achieves this. 

Currently, she is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, drinks, soaps, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, instant products, snacks, drinks, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install electrical wiring.

loans.name: Mwanaasha

texts.en:
Mwanaasha is 50 years old and married with four children between the ages of 30 and 18 years. Since last year, she has owned a business where she sells charcoal, selling to the neighborhood. In addition to this business, she also sells blocks for construction.

Mwanaasha is applying for a 10,000 KES loan from Yehu in order to buy more sacks of charcoal and expand her business. She hopes that this will help her increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Hard work and dedication are Virgilio’s guiding principles. He is married with four children, three of whom are married and one of whom – his youngest – is still young and currently a student. Virgilio wants a stable source of income so he can meet his family’s basic needs and let his youngest child finish his studies. His wife is a vegetable vendor and he is in the agricultural business, raising hogs and corn crops. 

Virgilio is thankful to God because in bad times and in good times he manages his agricultural business firmly. Now he plans to purchase hog feed and farm supplies for his corn field, but due to insufficient capital he is requesting a loan of PHP 35,000. He knows that this money would help him a lot, most especially in making his agricultural business more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to purchase hog feed and farm supplies for his corn field

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine owns a retail store. She is 50 years of age and married with three children. Josephine stands as both father and mother to her children because her spouse is an Overseas Filipino Worker. 

Josephine would like to ask for additional capital amounting to 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). She will use this amount of loan in buying stock of groceries to increase her sales and profit. She knows that her retail store will grow further because of her patience and resourcefulness. Josephine expects that her requested loan amount will be granted.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries for her retail store.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 55, is married and has three children; she lives in the town of Msambweni. She has always been a merchant. She’s been making and selling dumplings for five years. She has the business at home and she has a very good clientele.

She has worked with Yehu loans for one cycle. This current loan is for 25,000 KES that she’ll use to stock up on raw materials like wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.  

She hopes to continue working hard to continue to expand the business and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to stock up on raw materials like wheat flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is a hardworking and resourceful man. He is married with three children, all of whom currently go to school. Leo’s main priority is to increase the profit he generates from his livestock and farming business. This would allow him to send his three children into higher levels of education, improve their standard of living, and maintain his business. Leo would like to improve his hogs’ weight and make them healthier, but due to insufficient capital he is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000, which will allow him to purchase eight bags of hog feed as well as necessary vitamins. Leo believes that his goal will be fulfilled because he has the ability to make it happen through his determination, hard work, and the financial assistance he has requested from lenders.

loans.use: to purchase eight bags of hog feed and necessary vitamins

loans.name: Arthur

texts.en: Arthur has been raising hogs for more than ten years. He is 49 years of age, married and blessed with three children. He currently manages a livestock business and also a farming business. His main goal is to increase his profits to be able to educate his two children and provide them with comfortable living conditions. With his determination to improve his financial stability Arthur is seeking additional working capital amounting to PHP 45,000, which he will use to buy five piglets as well as hog feed for their daily sustenance.  He hopes that the loan he has requested will be granted.

loans.use: to buy five piglets as well as hog feed for their daily sustenance

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is an active micro-finance member of PMPC. She is 43 years old and married with 1 adult child and 6 school-age children. She engages in the sari-sari (general) store business selling a variety of basic commodities. She has operated her business for 2 years with an average monthly income of PHP 1,000. 

She has taken another loan from PMPC in the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional grocery stock to sell. She plans to use the profit to support the family needs and to save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stock to sell at her sari-sari (general) store.

loans.name: Candido

texts.en: Candido is a responsible and hard-working husband and father to his three children. He is glad because his wife is supporting him in improving his hog raising and farming business. Though he only has a high school education, he has still been able to make his farming business grow tremendously. Candido’s main priority is to earn more income so he can let his three children finish their studies and improve their living conditions. To make his dream come true he is asking for financial support in the amount of PHP 20,000, which will allow him to buy 8 sacks of hog feed and some farm supplies. He hopes to get this loan so he can continue to improve his hog raising and farming business.

loans.use: to buy 8 sacks of hog feed and some farm supplies

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 30-year-old married woman from Albur,Bohol. She is mother to a ten-year-old son. She is engaged in Calamay making. Calamay is a sticky sweet delicacy that is popular in many regions of the Philippines. It is made of coconut milk, brown sugar, and ground glutinous rice. She has been in the Calamay-making business for fifteen years. 

She has requested a loan of 10,000 to purchased additional ingredients like glutinous rice, brown sugar, and empty coconut shells. Teresita would like to augment her business to improve her family's standard of living and at the same time save for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like glutinous rice, brown sugar and empty coconut shells to support her Calamay-making business.

loans.name: Irenio

texts.en: Irenio is a married man with two children from the village of Salinungan East, San Mateo. He loves to care for animals; it’s been five years since he started raising ducks and chicken in his village. Irenio would like to continue to provide his ducks and chickens with the care they need, but he struggles with a shortage of funds, so he decided to take out a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy feed. He knows that this money would help him to attain his goal in life.

loans.use: to buy feed for his ducks and chickens

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy beads and threads for an embroidery business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita manages a sari-sari (variety) store and lives serenely at Estefania with her husband and two children. Clarita's family relies on her husband’s farming business and her retail store – which she has been running for over five years – for their income. She wants to keep earning a good income from her business so she can provide a good education for her children but she lacks funds to buy more merchandise to sell, so she is asking for PHP 50,000 to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs, bread and noodles to sell. This will help increase her sales capacity. 

Clarita promises to be responsible for paying back her loan. She hopes she and her husband will keep making good profits from their businesses so they can achieve a prosperous life for their family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits, eggs, bread and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en: Erwin is 22 years old and single. He is a hardworking farmer who plants and harvests rice to sell. He has had his business for over a year now, and pays laborers to help him with farming activities such as plowing, planting and transplanting rice seedlings. He is now asking for a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides necessary for providing his crops with proper nutrition. In the future, Erwin would like to continue making his farming business profitable so she can help his family achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 55 years old, married, and has three children. He lives peacefully with his family at Centro Sur. He is a farmer with a hectare of farmland on which he raises corn to harvest and sell. He usually earns PHP 30,000 each harvest season (twice a year). Magdalena, his wife, sells vegetables in order to supplement the family's income. 

Reynaldo still aims to improve his business, which is why he is asking for PHP 50,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for crop sustainability. He hopes to grow healthier crops and harvest them abundantly. Good profits will help to pay his children’s school fees, and will also give his family a better life.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est constitué deux femmes  mariées  et deux célibataires ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Torakabougou de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments, de chaussures, de céréales et  le divers.
AMI, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première assise de la droite vers la gauche. Elle fait l’achat vente de condiments et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 2 sacs de sel de cuisine ,4 cartons de cube maggi et un sac d’oignon avec les grossistes de Bougouni. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is composed of two married women and two single women averaging 40 years of ag,e with three children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and children in the Torakabougou district of the town of Bougouni.
They know each as neighbors, friends and fellow entrepreneurs. In order to bolster their financing capacity in order to better manage their businesses, they have joined the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution and are now on their second loan. The prior loan has been duly repaid. The group members sell condiments, shoes, cereals and miscellaneous items.

Ami, the group’s leader, is the first one seated from the right to the left. She busy and resells condiments and plans to use her loan to buy two bags of table salt, four boxes of Maggi bouillon cubes and a bag of onions from wholesalers in Bougouni. She sells at the market and out of her home, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed mainly of women. She plans to  earn average monthly revenue of 40,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvested in her business and repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Violine

texts.en:
Violine is a lady aged 35 years old, married and blessed with three children aged 16,12 and seven years old. She practices agriculture mainly tea plantations. She has been in operation for a period of five years earning a monthly income of KES. 10,000.  

She is requesting a loan of KES. 30,000 from KADET LTD, this being her third loan after she repaid the previous loans successfully and intends to use the amount to purchase green tea leaves for resale.

The anticipated profits, she will use to provide for the basic needs of her family and the plough back into her tea plantation farm. She hopes to succeed in business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase green tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married and has two children who currently go to school. She is a hog raiser within her community, and she and her husband work together on their corn field and livestock business. The couple aim to develop their corn farm in order to have a better standard of living and educate their two children.

Melanie is currently raising one sow. She hopes to keep her pig healthy upon reaching maturity. Then she can sell it at a profit and help her two children finish their studies. Melanie struggles with a shortage of capital, so she is requesting a loan of PHP 19,000.The money will be used to buy hog feed as well as for maintenance of her corn field. She is hoping to obtain this loan so she can gain a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and maintain her corn field.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI  est constitué de cinq femmes  mariées, une veuve et une célibataire ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier TORAKABOUGOU de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur deuxième prêt. Le précédent prêt a été correctement remboursé. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’habits et  de céréales, de parfum, de légumes et biens d’autres articles divers. 
FATOUMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première assise de la gauche vers la droite. Elle fait l’achat vente des habits et compte acheter avec son  prêt, 3 colis de friperies avec les grossistes  de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
TIESSIRI is a group which consists of five married women, one widow, and one unmarried woman.  On average, these women are 39 years old and have four children each.  They live in extended traditional families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons, in the Torakabougou neighborhood of the city of Bougouni.

They know one another through ties of community, friendship and commerce.  In order to bolster their financial capacity and to do better in business, they have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their second loan with the institution.  Their previous loan was duly repaid.

This women's group sells clothing, grains, perfumes, vegetables and many other various goods.

Fatoumata, the president of the group, is sitting first from the left in the photo.  She buys and sells clothes, and she is planning to use her loan to buy three boxes of used clothing from wholesalers in Bamako.  She sells at the market and from home, for cash or on credit, to a retail customer base which mostly consists of women.

She is expecting average monthly profits to reach 20,000 CFA francs, which will be invested in her business and also used to repay her loan.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Darwin Adonis

texts.es:
Darwin, 32 años de edad, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 11 años de edad, de oficio agricultor, originario de la comarca EL Tanque en las afueras de León. Su experiencia la adquirió cuando trabajaba para productores de melón, luego decidió emprender su propio negocio. Sus primeros cultivos fueron maíz, pipián  y ayote. Su rubro actual son las hortalizas y frutas aunque también siembra chile. A él le gustaría exportar toda su producción hacia mercados extranjero donde le ofrezcan un mejor precio por sus productos.  
Con la idea de ir diversificando sus siembras usara el financiamiento que está requiriendo para sembrar melón y  también instalar un sistema de riego ya que necesita darle buenas condiciones a los cultivos para obtener una producción con calidad. Otro de sus proyectos es la comercializar chile tabasco, para poder crecer poco a poco pues es un rubro que casi no se explotado en Leon.
texts.en:
Darwin is 32 years old, married, and has two children (ages 10 and 11). He is a farmer by trade and is originally from the region of El Tanque, which is outside of León. Darwin acquired experience while working for other melon producers, but he later decided to start his own business. The first crops he produced were corn, pumpkins, and squash. His current crops include vegetables and fruits, but sometimes he plants chile peppers. He would like to export everything he produces to foreign markets since they offer a better price for his products.

With the idea of diversifying his crops, Darwin will use the loan that he is requesting to plant melons and install an irrigation system that he needs to keep his crops in optimal condition and obtain production that is of good quality. Another one of his projects is to sell tabasco chiles so that he can gradually grow in a line of business that has yet to be exploited in León.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing melons and to install an irrigation system.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo is 53 years old. She is married with four children, and lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been in the agricultural business for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband helps her run the business. All of her children are employed. They earn about $13 daily. One of her children is a mechanic who works in a garage. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Sambo is requesting a loan of $1500 to purchase automobile repair tools to run a garage. The money will help her start this additional business and generate more income for her family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase automobile repair tools to start a garage

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en:
Vannak is 40 years old. He is married with four children, and lives with his family in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been in the agricultural business for more than twenty years, earning approximately $6 daily. His wife helps him run the business. One of his children is employed in a garment factory. 

Vannak is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase fertilizer for his farm. This purchase will help his crops and plants grow well and provide a high yield. In the future, he would like to expand his business and help his children achieve a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia has a retail business in the town of Nakuru. She has been in the business for two years and it has been profitable. She is 29 years old and a single mother of three children.

This will be her second loan term. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of retail goods such as sugar, rice and maize flour. She also plans to buy vegetables and fruits to sell in her business. She anticipates generating more profits with which she will buy a greater variety of goods to sell.

She hopes to grow her business into a wholesale shop and thereby make more income to be better able to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy retail goods,vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 37 years old and married to Njenga. She is blessed with three children aged 10, 15, and 20 years. She operates a timber yard and has been running this business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of KES 45,000.

She has borrowed a third loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD with which she intends to purchase more timber for resale. She also plans to use the funds for the expansion of the yard. The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her school-going children.

Her dreams are to improve her living standards and to own her own residential plot.

loans.use: to expand her timber yard.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 45 years old. She is married with four children and lives with her family in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been in the agricultural field for more than twenty years, and is experienced and successful in her business. She is involved in animal husbandry, fishing, and growing rice. She earns about $8 daily. Her husband helps her run the business. Two of her children are employed in Korea; they earn about $50 per day. 

Sokha is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase rice seeds to use for farming in the dry season. This money will help her maintain enough capital to operate her farming business. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children achieve a higher level of education. Moreover, she plans to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to use for farming in the dry season

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Sarun is 37 years old. She is widowed and resides with her five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been employed as a road construction worker for more than three years, earning approximately $3 per day. Four of her children are employed; they earn about $7 per day. 

Sarun is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase construction materials to build a toilet and bathroom. This money will help her provide hygienic living conditions for her family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store to generate additional income for the family, and build a new house if possible.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Thy is 45 years old. She is married with two children and lives with her family in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been selling clothes for more than nine years, earning approximately $9 daily. Her husband is involved in cultivating rubber plants; he earns about $28 each day. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Thy is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating more rubber plants. This money will help her expand the business and earn more income to support her family. In the future she would like to expand her farmland and build a new, bigger house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for cultivating rubber plants

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is 29 years old, married to Amos, and blessed with a three-year-old child. She runs an M-Pesa shop, a business she ventured into three years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase both Safaricom and Airtel credit cards, as well as to add float to her M-Pesa business. 

The profit she earns from this business will help her open another branch. Her dream is to see her business prosper and to become a millionaire someday.

loans.use: To purchase both Safaricom and Airtel credit cards and to add float to her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Raúl su esposo desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, de los cuales solo 2 viven con ellos: Anderson y Jefferson a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Paccha. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a la agricultura y la ganadería que hoy es su fuente de ingresos, cuando formo una familia a la lado de su esposo, decidieron intensificar esta actividad sembrando principalmente  papa y habas en gran cantidad. Además de pastizales para su ganado en diferentes terrenos de cultivo de los que han heredado ella y su esposo. La agricultura  es una actividad que le gusta mucho y disfruta de realizarla porque siempre está en contacto con el campo y la naturaleza y le trae mucha tranquilidad. Pero como ella es una mujer trabajadora, todas las mañanas saca a sus animales entre toros, vacas y ovejas para que puedan alimentarse, cuenta que desea realizar queso, pero todavía no cuenta con muchas vacas lecheras, pero lo que si realiza es el arado de la tierra con los toros que posee, “de esa manera ahorro la preparación de terreno por otras personas”, comenta. Muy pronto comprará más ovejas, con la ayuda de su esposo quien trabaja en una mina. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “productoras agrícolas las emprendedoras” y este es el octavo crédito con MFP, agradece el apoyo financiero que le otorgan de manera constante. Ahora tiene el medio para mejorar su negocio. Promete ser puntual con sus cuotas, ya que le enseñaron a ser responsable.
Emerita, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 toros de raza para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en:
Emerita, age 46, is a hardworking woman. She has lived with her husband Raúl for 26 years and they have four children. Two of them, Anderson and Jefferson, still live with them in their own home in the town of Paccha. Emerita has spent her entire life around farming and ranching, and now she makes her living in this manner. When she and her husband started their family, they decided to intensify their farming activity by planting mostly potatoes and beans in great quantity. Their cattle graze on different plots of land that she and her husband inherited. Farming is an activity she enjoys very much because it always keeps her in touch with the earth and with nature, which gives her great peace. Being hardworking woman, Emerita spends every morning letting her animals (bulls, cows, and sheep) out to pasture so that they can graze. She would like to start producing cheese, but she does not have very many dairy cows. However, she is able to plow her farmland with her existing bulls. “This keeps me from having to pay other people to prepare the land,” says Emerita. She will buy more sheep very soon, with the help of her husband who works at a mine.

Emerita is a member of the solidarity group “Productoras Agrícolas Las Emprendedoras”. This is her eighth loan with MFP and she is grateful for the financial support that has been provided to her in a constant manner. She now has the means to improve her business and promises to be punctual with her payments, thus demonstrating that she will be responsible. Emerita will invest the money she requested in the purchase of two pedigree bulls so that she can increase her herd of cattle.

loans.use: to buy two pedigree bulls.

loans.name: Manne Du Ciel Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyanchira, est un entrepreneur dynamique, âgée d’environ 48 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants et plusieurs autres enfants sous tutelle, qui étudient tous. Son mari est un vendeur de valise. Quant à la cliente, elle fait le commerce général. Environs 15 ans, elle exerce ces petites activités économiques. Elle commença avec un faible capital reçu de son mari, plus tard, elle adhéra dans un groupe élémentaire dit banque communautaire de Hekima. Aujourd’hui, elle est intégrée dans le groupe d’affaire  très restreint  dit « Manne du ciel », qui bénéficie de montant de crédit un peu plus significatif avec une large échéance. Ce nouveau prêt  doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec  2 casiers de Fanta, 2 fus d’huile, les savons, Primus, riz, etc. En plus, elle souhaite voir ses enfants grandir, accroitre son unité d’exploitation et construire une galerie commerciale. La cliente remercie Hekima pour ses actions d’autonomisation en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
Nyanchira, the featured borrower, is a dynamic entrepreneur who is about 48 years old, married, and the mother of six children.  She is also the guardian of several other children.  All her children attend school.  Her husband sells suitcases.

Nyanchira sells various grocery products and has been involved in this type of commercial activity for the past fifteen years or so.  She started her business using a small capital received from her husband.  Later on, she joined Hekima's basic community bank program.  Today, she is a member of the very small solidarity group "Manne du ciel" which provides slightly higher loan amounts and a longer repayment term.

She will use this new loan to buy two crates of Fanta, two barrels of oil, some soap, Primus (beer), rice etc.

Nyanchira wants to see her children grow up.  She would also like to increase the size of her business and build a small shopping center.  She thanks Hekima for empowering low-income women excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to buy two crates of Fanta, two barrels of oil, some soap, Primus (beer), rice etc...

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.en: Dilafruz is 19 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She has always dreamed of being a successful business lady. Some years ago she began her activity as a shop assistant. Also, Dilafruz sews very beautiful women’s dresses. She decided to start a new business of selling women’s clothes, in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. She studied by taking the course, "To Get Ahead," of a women's organization, and she got enough skills about business. She will be a very successful business woman, because she is hard-working and smart. She is asking for a loan of 2500 USD to buy women’s clothes for organizing her new business. By using the loan, she will make her business become a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better opportunities to progress, financially. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy women’s clothes for organizing a new business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy clothes, fabrics and embroidery materials, for her boutique business.

loans.name: Rogie

texts.en:
Rogie grows rice crops within his village. He has been running his rice field for five years. He is thankful, because his previous loan helped him so much, most especially in the development of his rice field and improvement of his financial stability.

Rogie would like to have continuous growth of his rice farming business. Therefore, he is seeking a loan of 20,000 PHP. He will use this amount to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and certified seed, and pay for preparation of his rice farm land for planting. He hopes for approval of his loan, so he could have a stable source of income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizer and certified seed, and pay for preparation of his rice farm land for planting.

loans.name: Rodolfo Alejandro

texts.es:
El señor  Rodolfo,  se dedica a su negocio de Prestación de servicios de transporte taxi, desde hace ocho meses, se encuentra ubicado en un punto muy bueno ya que esta asignado a un punto de taxis de un Mall de la Ciudad,  contando también con mucho clientes que lo llaman para solicitarle sus servicios lo prefieren por su buena atención.
Don Rodolfo esta solicitando crédito por valor de L. 15,000.00 para reparación y mantenimiento de uno de su vehículo ya que le esta dando problemas y el quiere tenerlo en optimas condiciones para prestar un servicio de calidad.
Don Rodolfo desea que su negocio le ayude a mantener a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Sr. Rodolfo has been providing taxi services for eight months. He is located in a very good area and has been assigned a taxi stop at a mall in the city. Rodolfo has many customers who call on him to request his services. They prefer to do business with him because he provides them a great deal of attention.

Don Rodolfo is requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that he can repair and maintain one of his vehicles that has been experiencing problems. He wants to keep it in optimal condition so that he can provide quality service. Don Rodolfo wants his business to provide the means of supporting his family and giving them a better quality of life.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – October 2012

loans.use: to buy spare parts and lubricants so that he can repair and maintain his taxi.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María, una humilde campesina, habitante de la comarca La Ceiba ubicada en las afueras de León. Gracia a  su primer crédito Kiva logro comprar comida para sus animales y criarlos de manera saludable lo que a su vez le permitió vender los cerditos a un buen precio, se siente muy orgullosa de los logro y de haber cancelado su crédito a tiempo, esto le impulso a seguir mejorando y lograr tener una granja de cerdos reproductores y tener mejores condiciones de vida. 
Está solicitando este financiamiento para comprar cerdos reproductores.
texts.en:
María is a humble country dweller. She resides in the region of La Ceiba, which is located on the outskirts of León. Thanks to her first Kiva loan, she was able to buy animals and raise them in a healthy manner. Eventually she was able to sell the piglets at a good price.

María is very proud of what she has achieved and that she was able to repay her loan on time. This encouraged her to continue improving so that she could have a pig breeding farm and better living conditions.

She is requesting this loan so that she can buy pigs for breeding.

loans.use: to buy pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Loeurn

texts.en:
Loeurn is 23 years old. She is married with three children and lives with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening animals for more than ten years, earning approximately $2 daily. Her husband is employed in a hotel, and earns about $7 per day. 

Loeurn is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase zinc and timber to fix part of her house. This money will help improve her living conditions. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children get a higher education.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and timber to fix part of her house

loans.name: Kim Heng

texts.en:
Kim Heng is 27 years old. She is married with two children and lives with her family in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She has been selling fish for more than ten years, earning approximately $10 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 each day. 

In order to improve her business, Kim Heng is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase more fish to sell. This money will help her expand her business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to use her profits to expand the business further and help her children earn their bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 40-year-old married lady. She is blessed with four children aged 20, 17, 14 and 11. She has been operating a green grocer’s for six years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000. She has borrowed her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, with which she intends to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to pay her children’s school fees. Her dreams are to improve her standard of living and own her own residential plot.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Gervas

texts.en: Gervas is a 31-year-old man who is married with three children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business for six years now and earns a monthly income of four thousand shillings. This will be his second loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase spare parts for his motorcycle. In the future he wants to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Kepha

texts.en: Kepha is 30 years old and supports a family of four people. He makes and distributes baked bread and donuts. He has been running the business for the past four years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has borrowed his first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD with which he intends to purchase a bicycle to assist in the distribution process. The anticipated profits will be reinvested to boost the business. His future dream is to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a bicycle to transport his products

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, de 46 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de sus dos hijas, Hely y Emili a las que cuida en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a la agricultura y la ganadería que hoy es su fuente de ingresos, cuando formó una familia al lado del que fue su esposo, hace 20 años.
